description:
Cantina Verde is awesome! This week I had a number of meetings my team needed food for and Cantina Verde was fantastic. We ordered breakfast twice and lunch twice and everyone loved the food. All of the salsas, sides and guac were super fresh. The meat and sides were seasoned really well.  

On a customer service note, Ada, the catering director is the best. She called me after I submitted my order, was early for delivery every time, set up all the food with beautiful presentation, and followed up a few hours later to make sure everyone enjoyed. 

Overall a great experience with Cantina Verde, I definitely will be back.
author: Lindy B.

description:
This place was ok. Service was great but food just ok. I came in around 1:30 pm on a Friday for lunch and ordered right away. I got a burrito with the chipotle chicken. I'm not sure if it was the chicken, rice, or anything else in the burrito but it was extremely salty. If I come back I will probably try something else. 

Not bad but better than chipotle. Good for lunch if you are looking for something quick. If I am looking for an authentic burrito I will go somewhere else.
author: Taylor F.

description:
The best way to describe Cantina Verde is bland. You can kind of see it the moment you go inside - the white interior and minimalistic design almost look sterile.

I got a carne asada burrito, and the meat was chewy without much flavor to it. Beans were kind of old too, and though I added jalapenos, it didn't really do anything for me.
author: Casey S.

description:
I went here for a quick breakfast during work. My ideal breakfast is truly lunch and this was the closest I can get. I got the egg whites, red pepper,
Black beans and all the toppings available. It felt fresh and flavorful. The other notable thing was that the portion size was truly huge and I did not finish it. Considering SF prices I feel like I got my money's worth. This will definitely be in my list of go to breakfasts
author: Sharvari J.

description: As far as fast food goes I think this place kicks chipotle, cava, and every other chipotle style restaurants butt. Don't get me wrong it's very similar to chipotle but the ingredients are so fresh and so much more tasty. I'm glad I stumbled upon it.
author: Sam P.

description: Updating my review for a recent catering occasion: we requested Cantina Verde for a company lunch event, and Ada was extremely pleasant to work with and came right on time (even though it sounded like they were neck deep in orders). She set up the food quickly, and even gave us free chips and salsas. Everyone enjoyed the food! Would definitely recommend them for your catering needs. Thanks Ada!
author: Cathy C.

description: We just had a lunch catered here from Cantina Verde. We did a taco bar for about 13 people, and 2 of their large catered salads. My whole office LOVED it. Super fresh, flavorful, and just the right amount of food for a catered office lunch. We had both chicken and steak taco bar, and even the person who delivered it was super professional, friendly, and very well prepared. Was so nice that she set everything up for us too, instead of just dumping the food and leaving. I have already been told by several people that we need to order from here for lunch again, and we definitely will!
author: Becca R.

description: had the verde house salad, it was a huge salad. It is crazy busy during lunch hours and there is seating. The food is fresh, the tortilla chips were a little bit not crunchy but overall the food was good.
author: Maria N.

description:
It's probably more than just salads, but for me it's been a go-to quick and tasty salad-house. I've had the "Verde House Salad" and the "Fiesta Salad," both with chicken, quite a few times.

Both the salads are built on a mound of crisp (as in fresh, not fried) shredded lettuce, black beans, and chicken. It's either the cilantro lime chicken, or the chipotle chicken; they are both served warm and contrasts the cold ingredients of the salad really well. The mustard, and the chipotle based creamy dressings are both delicious but may well prove to be  calorie-bombs, so be wary of that when dressing your salad.

I love the mango in the fiesta salad, as well as the salsa-avocado in it's verde counterpart, as are the sweet corn and boiled egg, depending what you chose to partake in.

In conclusion, these very generous portions of salads represent a well composed compromise between the balance of healthy and tasty.
author: Umesh T.

description:
Worst customer service I have experienced in a long time!!!! I had a strange experience on the first visit when a well dressed, articulate black women in business attire comes in. The business has a posted policy that you must make a purchase if you need to use their bathroom, understandable. The lady complies by purchasing a coffee and by this time she is clearly dancing in place because she had to use the restroom. The manager responds by telling her that she did not spend enough money, we were both in complete shock!!!! I paid for my breakfast burrito, which by the was was bland to say the least, then I asked for the door code to the bathroom where I proceeded to give it to the lady in need. I should have posted a review right away but thought that everyone can have an off day.

Yesterday I came in and stood at starting point to order my breakfast burrito and waited there almost 7 minutes, clearing my voice and trying to politely get the employees attention, but they looked right through me and never acknowledging my presence. As I begin to turn and walk away, a gangly white male walks up behind me and they instantly as him if they can help him, I just thought, "WHAT IN THE ACTUAL F" I was furious but went on about my way and got breakfast from a much friendlier and accommodating restaurant, Focaccia, where the food was fast, hot, delicious, made fresh and the customer acknowledged was immediate and professional. 

I tried to give Verde a second chance but this second visit just further confirmed that this place is absolute garbage when it come to serving people. Horrible customer service and their staff needs retraining!!!! Don't waste your time or energy there.
author: Darrin M.

description:
So after my most recent Mexican "Veg" Salad experience (let me catch you up, it wasn't veg), I was pretty much having Mex Salad PTSD. So when a coworker said we should get burritos/Mexican food, I hadn't planned to get anything.

Lo and behold, he ended up choosing Cantina Verde - which I had carefully bookmarked after seeing photos of their salad. This is like a Chipotle with way more options. But with decisions comes indecision.

They have pre-set menu items and also a make your own salad. Wahoo. Of course I choose that. So I start adding everything under the sun - grilled onions, regular onions, grilled squash, cooked mushrooms, pico de gallo, corn, tomatoes, eggs (I made her pick mostly whites) and then....okay they have listed avocado is extra, but why are cucumbers 50 cents extra? Why is mango salsa $1 extra? Why? I feel like this place invites pricing confusion so beware.

However, for $9 or so, you get a much bigger salad than elsewhere in the city. So it isn't a bad deal. It's an SF meal steal deal. Just double check what is extra and what isn't. 

Anyway, I am for sure returning.
author: Libby J.

description:
I thought I would give Cantina Verde a chance especially since they seem to be popular with the lunchtime crowds. However, my experience can be summed as mediocre at best.

I'm not sure if I missed a sign or anything, but the worse part about my experience was that there was no explicit signage pointing out the limit of extras you can put on your tacos. I assumed that we can put a bit of everything, but sadly, the worker misheard me and gave me the two things I wanted to be omitted. 

The three tacos- carne asada ($1 extra), chipotle chicken, and carnitas were fine, but lacked any flavor that Chipotle has. Even homemade tacos with my friends tasted better than these. 

Beyond the flavor issue, I was sad to discover that they don't use fresh corn. Their corn tasted exactly like the canned corn you get from Trader Joe's. 

Long story short: save yourself the disappointment, and walk to Chipotle a block away.
author: Eva L.

description:
Amazing team of people very considerate and cooperative. Super attentive and excellent food delivery service and catering.
I had ordered food for an office event and they did an absolutely emaculate job setting up and delivering right on time. They made sure the food stays warm till the time people eat them, provided small burners and set the stands up. Beautifully decorated the food and so presentable. I had ordered taco bar with chicken and steak. We had tofu for vegans. Excellent vegan salad and mango relish , salsa, guacamole tastes heavenly. Will totally recommend this place for dinning and for any event catering too.
author: Neo R.

description:
Another MealPal review! Rather recently, the portion sizes are less. Cantina Verde used to give you the same amount as if you were to order regularly; this was the best part of it. The salads are pretty filling and full of flavor from the well-seasoned chicken and the dressing.

During the lunch rush, you could sometimes see the line go out the door and wrap around the corner. This one time, I even saw a substantial MealPal line, which is surprising.
author: James N.

description: Thank you for responding to my comment about the issue with pricing for chips and guacamole. I like going here because the staff is friendly and you get quality food!
author: Lisa H.

description:
I don't know why this place gets so much hate! I really enjoy coming here. The ingredients are fresh and very flavorful+ organic! I would say it's a upgraded version of chipotle for the same price. Where else can you find a huge salad in the Fidi for under nine bucks? I really like their Fiesta Salad that I usually get through mealpal. It has Lettuce, Kale, Cilantro, Chicken, Black Beans, Cheese, Tomatoes, Mangoes.. AND this amazing mustard vinaigrette. The ingredients just bend very well together and the chicken is grilled to perfection. Probably one of the best salads I've tried. I've also tried their Verde house salad, but would pick the fiesta over it. 

I didn't care for the horchata or aguas frescas here. I like my horchata to have a strong cinnamon flavor and this didn't cut it for me. Also, the aguas frecas were way to sweet for my liking.
author: Mehak D.

description:
Cantina Verde vs. Chipotle this place will always win!!! 
They're not stingy they have plenty of different meat options that toppings are endless plus  the staff is friendly and the establishment clean. I just love this place!
author: T A.

description:
Came here for lunch two times on a weekday. 

Food: They have the same options as Chipotle (tacos, burritos, bowls) but seems healthier. I have gotten a tofu bowl and the tofu tacos. I liked the tacos better because they weren't as heavy. The bowl almost had too much tofu. The one thing I dislike about this place is how big the tofu chunks are, if they could just cut them half the size it would be perfect. 

Service: The service here is like Chipotle too.  You stand in line, order and watch them make your food as you tell them what you want on your meal. The line went very quick. 

Ambiance: Inside is very clean and modern. Lots of seating and I love the bright green colors they have everywhere. 

I would come back and get the tacos. The bowl was too heavy for me.
author: Hayley D.

description: Their food is good, but they don't cook their chicken thoroughly. I have gotten sick a few times because of this.
author: Jackie H.

description:
Terrific, quick service for breakfast and lunch; both dine in (limited seating) or in my case, grab & go. 
The organic locally sourced ingredients are both simple, fresh and reliable. Add on's like avocado, extra vegetables and so on are both fairly priced and predictable. Service is very friendly and efficient.

The food is reliable and the location is excellent. This is one of many Financial District quick stops during what is certain to be another full day living in this most busy of districts in San Francisco.
author: Michael G.

description: Delicious and cheap. Every time I go here I wonder why I don't go more often. The salads are great value and you can add multiple high protein items to your chicken like egg and beans for no extra cost.
author: nicole f.

description: Breakfast shouldn't cost $9. Or at least for what i was served.  Five oz serving of pinto beans, three oz serving oz diced potato, three oz serving Turkey sausage diced,  approximately 1 oz of guacamole and a dusting of cheese in a bowl. Had i elected to get a burrito it would have been a chicito. No thank you.... cant go back.
author: Francis M.

description: AVOID AVOID AVOID ... This place is a nightmare ... I got a salad and found a live insect in it ... watch what you're serving guys !!
author: Aditi T.

description: Chipotle with more veggie and sauce options but missing key criteria: fresh chips to go with your burrito bowl. Also the portions are super small, Chipotle doesn't skim on ingredients.
author: Alita M.

description:
My only regret is that I did not try Cantina Verde sooner. I'd like to point out how fantastic the staff is. They're always so friendly and never seem rushed.

The food is outstanding. I especially love the cilantro lime chicken. I would also recommend the tomatillo salsa. Many of my fiends love their salads. 

Prices are very reasonable but this place is packed during lunch hour. The food is always fresh and high quality.
author: Jacqueline M.

description:
Great food with quality ingredients and options.

I absolutely love this place because of their delicious fresh food. I do love Chipotle but after visiting Cantina Verde, I honestly cannot think of a reason to go eat at Chipotle anymore.

The only con I can think of is the duration of wait during lunch time.

Highly recommended.
author: Manpreet S.

description: Got the Fiesta salad here and it was good but filling. I was trying to be healthy by getting a salad for lunch and this definitely didn't do it. It tasted great but I could feel how unhealthy it was. There were chips and eggs and dressing etc tart made it filling. I couldn't eat the whole thing for lunch but would get it again.
author: Danielle B.

description:
Stopped by for lunch today for a steak salad and GOD THIS THING TASTES AMAZING. They give you a huge box of vegetables - you can either get romaine lettuce or mixed greens, brown or white rice, choice of meat, and so many toppings such as onions, salsa, corn, boiled egg, etc. I was so excited that the boiled egg comes with the salad because it's usually charged more. The steak is delicious and they don't skimp on the portions like Chipotle might. For around $9 I don't think you can get these ingredients and portions anywhere else. 

I definitely will be coming back here and really recommend trying this place out for lunch if you're looking for a healthier option around this area!
author: My N.

description: Amazing salads ! Fresh salads .. my go to salad place in the financial district! Though they put beans in the first salad and Verde house salad I could feel the difference in taste compared to other salad places. There's always s line during lunch hours.
author: Aravind J.

description: I've walked down here so many times, but now just finally stood in line to see what was up. This is a great Fusion Mexican spot that is sort of like Chipotle, but has some really good ingredients. I came here and ordered a Salad which is sort of like all of the stuff in a burrito just in salad form. It was really good. I ordered romaine lettuce with chicken and all the works including sour cream, corn, mango salsa and cheese. It came out well and for $9.00 it was a lot of food! I ate it up and was very full. I will definitely come back here again soon to try a burrito this time around!
author: James R.

description:
My co worker and I decided to try out Cantina Verde after walking past it one day during our break and seeing the "Breakfast Burrito" sign outside. We decided to try it out the next day for lunch. I ordered a bowl with carnitas, onion, corn, black bean, white rice, guacamole, and salsa. I really enjoyed my bowl it was very flavorful the only downfall of it was it was super salty. 

I really like how you can customize it in so many ways. There are a ton of toppings that you can get. The prices are super reasonable considering that this is the Financial District. They also have a variety of aqua frescas as well. I really enjoyed the watermelon one, as it was super fresh, light and refreshing. 

The line does get long but it goes by really quick. The service was fast and friendly as well.
author: Yinja L.

description:
Hi the salad I had here was definitely a good sized and very tasty definitely worth the mealpal cost.    I will definitely look at this place as an option for lunch. :)   You can judge by how it looks. 

Nice space.
author: Homer S.

description: Cantina Verde has the best salads! Both the Verde House and Fiesta Salad are filling and delicious! The chipotle dressing on the Verde House Salad is spicy and there are many ingredients including beans, hard boiled egg, and jicama.  Verde House Salad is one of my fave salads of all time because of all the variety of ingredients. The service via Mealpal is fast and the staff that I spoke to at Cantina Verde was friendly and efficient.
author: Jen L.

description:
This review is strictly for Cantina Verde's catering service.

I've used Cantina Verde to cater office breakfast and once for a large happy hour we hosted in the office. 

The most important thing that keeps me coming back for more is the easy ordering interface on their website, prompt, professional delivery, and most importantly Ada! Ada goes above and beyond to make sure even a simple breakfast burrito spread looks like something special. She has baskets and other things like placemats that make a real difference in how the food is displayed. Most food delivery, even catering, in the Financial District is just a drop-off-and-sign-here kind of thing. Not with Cantina Verde. Ada thinks of catering the way an office manager would. She sets aside the tops to the salsa rather than throwing them out so they can go back in the fridge. She pays attention to the way people will approach the food and what order they will want to add it to their plate. I like these kind of details.

Now for the food. The breakfast burritos are amazing. They are fresh with real tomatoes and plenty of flavor and quality meat. They also do vegan and vegetarian breakfast burritos that taste even better than the meat ones, which can be hard to find in the area. These are the only breakfast burritos I get rave comments about from all of the employees. They are truly different than the standard in the best way.

The taco bar we had for our happy hour was also thoughtfully assembled for our needs. Ada brought chafing dishes so the food would stay hot. She made the display look abundant, festive and inviting - something that is important when you're trying to get people out of their work minds and ready to eat and socialize. She also did all of this on very short notice. Like VERY short. Probably the most amazing thing she did (and I know this sounds tiny) is that when I forgot to order guacamole, she ran back to the store, packed some up for me and met up with me out in the neighborhood where I was picking up other stuff for our event. 

One last thing: Aguas Frescas delivered in pitchers! What a great thing to add to breakfast to make it a little better.

I highly recommend using Cantina Verde if you want a professional, thoughtful and delicious catering experience in the Financial District!
author: Kelly R.

description:
"Yeah we're kind of like chipotle, in that our set up is very similar. But we are a little different"

That was a statement from a rather humble employee from Verde. Allow me to keep it real for him:

"Yeah we like chipotle, but better."

But exactly how are they better? Let's analyze under the following exhibit.
--
Exhibit Guac:

In 2016, the second most commonly used phrase in the United States was "You know that Guac costs extra?". (#1 most commonly used phrase was, of course, "The Warriors Blew a 3-1 Lead.") Being reminded that guac costs extra is exceptionally sinister. Instantly after acknowledging the extra cost, you get to observe a Chipotle trained employee scoop up a measured and meager spoon of guac. Just as the rain of regret begins to sprinkle on your life, you witness the employee go through the final step of company protocol and begin fiercely smacking the scoop of guac against the counter to fling off any extra guac over the spoon.... to rob you of any excess guac that spilled over that calculated, pitiful spoon....The employee then shifts his eyes from your burrito and into your soul, "Yeah homie. You done got hustled."

Guac-enthusiasts are spared from this terrible experience at Verde. Get this: Verde employees do not remind their customers that guac costs extra, BECAUSE GUAC IS FREE!!! That's right, every customer is entitled to a healthy slab of guac on their burritos/bowls/salads. Sure, it's not a monster scoop (not that chipotle's scoop is either), but it's free! What's more, you can even add slices of avocado, in addition to your guac, ALSO FREE. No more psychological abuse from "You know that Guac costs extra?" No more regrets on saying yes to the guac. Verde got you covered on your guac needs.
--

Just based on the guac exhibit above, Verde already earned the epithet - Chipotle, but better. But if you want to see further proof on why Verde is Chipotle on crack, feel
free to check out the bonus exhibit below.

--
Bonus Exhibit: Vegetarians

At Chipotle, a vegetarian burrito is either plain, or you get some bull known as Sofritas. What is Sofritas exactly? Chipotle claims that it's tofu, but our experience tells us otherwise.

At Verde, a vegetarian burrito can be defaulted into a Tofu Burrito. (Unlike Sofritas, I can attest that they're actually cubes of Tofu)

The Tofu Burrito can be accompanied by 3 of the 4 following veggies:

-Mushrooms!
-Fajitas (Chipotle has this option as well)
-Chopped cucumbers
-Freshly grilled onions, evident by the dude grilling them on a nearby grill

And yes, the guac mentioned in the first exhibit can also be applied to your Veggie Burrito, FOR FREE!
author: Ringo M.

description: I am a big fan of Cantina Verde and it makes me kind of sad that this place only has 3 1/2 stars. It also puzzles me because the lines are always long and it's obviously a fan favorite to a lot of people in FiDi. The Verde House Salad is my favorite but you can also customize to the way you want it. Cantina Verde reminds me of a sophisticated version of Chipotle. Love this place. !!!
author: Grace L.

description:
Went here for lunch and tried their steak burrito bowl.
Don't let the long line fool you. The staff at this location moves the line fast. It also helps when you know what you want to get.
They serve fresh ingredients daily and their presentation is way better than chipotle. I loaded my steak bowl with extra steak and all the fixin's

It always pays off to be nice to the person helping you and chat it up a bit. The scoop portions became more generous as we got to talking. My burrito bowl was heavy! It was all worth it for $9.00

I will be coming back to this place!
author: Rommel Q.

description:
Horrible service with rude staff. Treat customers like a production line. 

Very disappointed
author: Harneet G.

description:
When your staff votes on Breakfast Burritos for an all staff breakfast - you realize it's not easy to find a breakfast burrito caterer for 100+

Enter Cantina Verde!  We worked with Ada, who helped us order - including a few dietary restrictions - with ease.  You can place the order online and narrow it down to a 30 minute delivery window.

The burritos were great - bacon, chicken apple sausage, chorizo, veggie, vegan - our staff enjoyed them!
author: Katy M.

description: Definitely good food with tasty ingredients but it's a bit underwhelming how little they give you for the price they charge. I can't eat beans so I ask for an extra veggie option but am stonewalled. And to top it off, simple options like lettuce, onions, cilantro etc are apparently limited? I was told that lettuce was 50 cents extra after getting onions and cilantro. It's lettuce and judging from the look of it, iceburg lettuce, so nothing so special. At some point itll make it hard to justify this place for the price versus just getting Chipotle.
author: Nirav C.

description:
Went here for the first time today with a friend. Overall a decent spot for a quick lunch in the FiDi area but nothing mindblowing (i.e. a solid 3 stars in my mind).

I got there around 11:45 and the line was already pretty long (about ~15 people in front of us) but it moved fairly quickly and we were able to order in 10 min or so.

My main impression as I was ordering was that I felt very rushed going through the line. I barely had time to look around at all the different toppings before I was rushed onto the next person. 

For example, there were no labels so I wasn't sure which salsa was which, and when I hesitated because I wasn't sure, the lady handed my bowl to the next person on the assembly line and I had to ask him about the mild salsa.

I got the bowl with white rice, pinto beans, carne asada, corn, lettuce, guacamole, and mild salsa. Unfortunately I didn't realize the mild salsa was the one with a ton of cilantro (which I can't stand) or else I would've skipped it...labels definitely would've helped.

The actual bowl was decent. Paid around $10 for it and it was pretty filling. The carne asada was a bit on the dry side, but I thought it was well flavored and went along with the rice and guacamole really well.

There are a couple tables scattered throughout, but it seemed like this was mostly a takeout place. My friend and I ate here and did not have a trouble finding a table even though it was right around peak lunch time at noon.

I work really close to here so I'll probably come back here once in a while. It's a better alternative to Chipotle for me for one simple reason: this place has wayyyyy less cilantro in its ingredients. The less cilantro, the better!!
author: Dianna H.

description:
My first thought was that is just another version of Chipotle but after a couple visits, I feel this place has its own unique experience.
The food are fresher and the line moves faster. 
I usually get burrito bowl with steak and add-ons for 9 bucks. Can't beat the deal.
author: Russ C.

description: I'm a huge fan of customer service and was a big fan of this place but I took a coworker here today and received major attitude from the employee making my burrito bowl. As he was making my bowl he put a small amount of rice in the bowl, it did not even cover the bottom of the bowl it was so sparse so I asked for a little more rice and he responded "You should have asked for extra rice" I responded back saying "I can see far more bowl then rice, I didn't think I would have to ask for extra". He put some more rice in the bowl then threw the spoon down and scooped my beans and threw that spoon down then tossed my bowl to the next employee and walked away. I was ready to just leave that place and my bowl but I hadn't eaten breakfast and it just wasn't worth it. Very disappointed and sad to say I will not be going back there. Additionally it seems like they're charging more for toppings then they used to.
author: Ra Sjeon H.

description: I got my salad with meal pal and there's dirt all over the lettuce. I have eaten probably about 50 salads from this place and I'm feeling pretty disappointed at their lack of care.
author: Liz C.

description:
Better than Chipotle's! The staff is always friendly, smiling, and attentive. I often hear the manager reducing the price when someone gets a simple burrito (like just beans, rice, and cheese). 

House salad is my go to lunch. No dressing (tasty without) and I get double jicama instead of chips. 

Full disclosure, I usually go in for breakfast and off-peak hours (because why spend half your lunch standing in line) so I'm not sure how they handle the "pressure" of the lunch rush.
author: Ruthe R.

description: I used to love this place because they use fresh ingredients and tasty proteins for great price. But ever since I start getting them on Mealpal, I've noticed that they start to skimp out on the quantity and ingredients in their salad. The amount of lettuces in my house salad today barely covered bottom of the box. There were also things missing from what's listed on the menu (probably too good at skimping lol).
author: Z P.

description:
Big fan of their cantina verde salad.Very generous portion sizes, everything tastes fresh, and I like the chicken and jicama especially. Seems packed for lunch though the lines move quickly. 

Definitely worth the mealpal cost.
author: Cindy W.

description: My favorite salad place in sf so far!! You definitely get your bang for your buck, as my salad cost $7.95 for a make your own. I got half cilantro lime chicken and half tofu - both are highly recommended! I got a balsamic cilantro sauce (I think) and it was well balanced. Would come again!
author: Serena W.

description: Awesome catering experience! We ordered a bunch of burritos from here for lunch. Everything arrived right on time and the catering director, Ada, did a great job setting everything up. The burritos were very tasty, I loved the fresh ingredients and flavors. My coworkers were all very happy with the lunch! I would definitely over from them again in the future.
author: Gabriela S.

description: I tried Cantina Verde today. I have to disagree with the comments that staff is friendly and helpful. They were actually very rude today and actually gave me incorrect information just to keep it moving.  I specifically asked if mango has onions mixed in and they said of course not.  Now, bringing the lunch back at my desk - mango has lot of onions in it - should have checked right then but I trusted them.  Also, even though I ordered house salad and I told them thats what I ordered - they charged extra for avocados (which is included in the house salad). I corrected them twice but they insisted since I said no to eggs it doesn't qualify as house salad.
author: Chintan D.

description: I've been going to this place ever since it opened. Never again! First they raised their prices so that they are now more expensive than Chipotle. Then they started charging for cilantro. Now they are charging for onion as well (and who knows what else). This is ridiculous! Cilantro and onion are cheap things to buy. Nicke and diming patrons is no way to run a business. And they still don't carry hot sauce. Unbelievable. Never going back.
author: Jason D.

description:
Early to a meeting this morning, I had time for some food and the breakfast burrito caught my eye... but when at the ordering counter I noticed the carne asada burrito to be the same price $8.95 so I went for the real deal!  Clean and friendly, it was very promising.  As I selected my stuffings, I started with the rice... thinking it was dirty rice I pointed at the brown rice.  Staff told me it's brown rice.... so I chose the other one.  Needless to say, the rice was meh.  No saffron, no chicken stock flavor... nada.

Then I chose all the other ingredients including my carne asada (had to mention it again).  All wrapped up, I tore into it.  So disappointing.  It was still flavorless.  No spices or salt on the carne asada.  Pretty bland.  So I asked for more salsa... still did not do the trick.  And sour cream is extra $0.50 btw....

It's fresh and saltless... no seasoning like garlic or ancho or saffron.... or whatever is in a good burrito meat.  Oh well.  Ate only 1/2 and that's all folks!
author: A C.

description:
I work around the area so this is my go to place when I want a salad with a Latin taste. I have tried their burrito bowls and are satisfying but I always get a romaine salad with the chipotle dressing. This is by far the best chipotle dressing I've had. I always add the lime chicken, brown rice, corn, cucumber and chips to my salad. It's a good serving size, possibly even for 2 people. They have a decent variety of drinks. BTW they serve aguas frescas (definitely a plus for latinos)! 

Service: They typically always have a long line but it moves fairly quick which I like. Reminds me of Chipotle serving system. Employees are nice and quick to take orders.
author: Rose M.

description:
Amazing breakfast burritos! The burritos are HUGE (mine lasted me three meals) - stuffed with eggs, your choice of meat (bacon, chorizo, or apple sausage), potatoes, beans, mushrooms, grilled vegetables, salsa, etc). It's a Chipotle-style restaurant, where you order at the counter and tell the person behind it what ingredients you would like to add to your meal. Choice of flour or wheat tortilla, and many other options for things to add. There was no line when I came in the morning around 8:45am, and the woman making my burrito was really nice. Every scoop of filling that she added was huge! Breakfast only is served from 7-10am, and their other lunch menu items are served after that.

Breakfast burritos are around $7, and considering how much food you get, it's definitely worth it!! Such a big bang for your buck and delicious too! Will most likely be back to try some of the lunch items or even if I'm hungry in the morning for another (very filling) breakfast burrito.
author: Kathy C.

description: Staff is a friendly. Clean place.  Open early. Breakfast burritos are just okay.  I've had way better burritos but like the fact these r semi healthy...spent about $10 on a chicken apple sausage, black beans, egg whites, guacamole, salsa, cheese, potatoes, on wheat wrap.
author: Jill P.

description:
Seems like Chiptole clone, but with more options for fillings.  Doesn't compare to what you can get from a joint in the Mission or even a sketchy looking taco truck.  The burritos feel haphazardly thrown together with novice wrapping techniques.

After I paid, I noticed I got charged 50¢ for chips, which I didn't ordered.  When I asked about this, the person at the cashier said it was because I got extra dairy; extra dairy being sour cream *and* cheese.  I pointed out the "No Charge"  section of the menu where dairy resided and the cashier admitted that the sign needed to be updated since many customers have complained about the charge.  Having created a bit of a backup, I was refunded that 50¢ probably due to exasperation.  The whole overcharging under the guise of "No Charge" rubbed me the wrong way.  And to boot, the food quality didn't make up for that snafu.

Carnitas Burrito: The carnitas were tender, but they lacked any crispy ends that more authentic carnitas typically have.  The burrito wrap was loose, resembling a blob rather than a tightly rolled cylinder.  This made it sloppy... well more sloppy than a typical burrito.  The choose you own tortilla, rice and beans made it quite a heavy meal which would probably satisfy those focused on quantity at a reasonable price.  There were so many options, it felt like Subway.  But the risk of mass customization is that clients may not choose the best flavor profile.  It would have been nice if someone with a culinary degree curated a few themed burritos with well thought out ingredient pairings.
author: Adam B.

description:
It's pretty telling that in the two times I've tried this place, several months apart, there was a long lunch line, mostly suits, yet no one sitting at any of the tables. What's that about? I mean even at Chipotle, its obvious inspiration, there is always somebody who wants to sit under those weird faux-Mayan wall hangings and wolf down a burrito. But not at Cantina Verde, a rather generic place from a decor perspective, and I guess people just don't want to stick around. I sure haven't been tempted. It's not ugly or unclean, it's just, well, dull. Speaking of which, can anybody remember what their menu is (photo: http://bit.ly/1AswJmT)? That's probably because it's fairly identical to Chipotle's except they claim to be fresher and healthier.

Maybe. But it's also a whole lot blander like senior-center bland. I ordered the same thing both times, the $7.95 Verde House Salad (photo: http://bit.ly/1PG6ErD). BTW, it actually went up by 45-cents between visits. The salad consists of a plastic bin full of Romaine lettuce (locally sourced, of course), grilled chipotle chicken, black beans, sweet corn, tortilla chips, cherry tomatoes, hard-boiled egg, chili-dusted jicama, cotija cheese and avocado, all of it doused in a chipotle dressing. The term 'avocado' is emboldened and underlined in the menu to separate it from all the make-your-own salads that don't offer it. All of it sounded just fine, and frankly it tasted just fine. It just made me feel like the nurse was about to wheel me back to my room after bingo.

FOOD - 3 stars...bland Mexican food just seems wrong no matter how fresh it may be
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...clean but apparently nobody likes to sit here
SERVICE - 2.5 stars...automated with minimal eye contact
TOTAL - 3 stars...hey, I'm not that much of a Chipotle fan either so what do I know?
author: Ed U.

description:
I went on a weekday for lunch and LOVED it! It gets packed during 12 and 1 pm. But the lines move fast so don't get scared by the long lines. 

Lots of choices and pretty cheap ($8.50) and YUMMY! 

You get a choice of mixed greens or lettuce as a base. And you can add your own beans/rice/protein/salsas/vegetables/guac/cheese etc. 

Love the concept and the food. Highly recommend it!
author: Hiral P.

description:
Not here to discuss food though.  My issue is with their website and customer service.
The prices for food advertised on their website are not the prices when you walk in the door.  Very misleading.  I rely on the web search to find a place and I guess I don't expect the price on their website to be different.  They need to be consistent.  Also, I pointed (actually showed) the cashier the price difference and the fact that they advertise items for free (veges, etc.) when in fact they are charging for such items.  I was still charged $0.50 for a "free" item,.  The place reminds me of Chipotle.  I was not that impressed.  I can get a better deal at Chipotle.  Won't visit again.
author: Casandra B.

description: This is my go-to for a quick, healthy, solid lunch. I love the guys who takes your initial order. Great, quick service!
author: Danielle W.

description: This place is like Chipotle but with less oily meat, avacados as an option for the bowl, and is maybe a bit pricier. The meats taste healthier and more flavorful, and you also have an option to do half-half for the meats!
author: Victoria T.

description:
Total Chipotle ripoff but clearly not as good hence no lines which is about the only good thing it has going. 

The setup is exactly like chipotle - choose a protein, toppings, and add ons.
I got a steak salad - portions a pretty big but the steak pieces were chewy/ tough and totally lacked flavor. 

The rice was bland, the sauteed peppers/onion topping was mushy and somewhat bitter. The dressing looked like jar thousand island - so I passed. The salsa was odd - not light and refreshing but rather thick like a marinara sauce....the sour cream was watered down...you get the idea

The whole salad was odd and not one of my better lunches. Just go to chipotle - heck of a lot better.
author: Brenda L.

description:
Who cares if they're ripping off chipotle? They have better sauces, more selections, and cheaper prices.

And in Fidi, can you really expect more?
author: Mingmei N.

description: House salad is one of my top items around for lunch.  Filling yet healthy.  Ton of great ingredient and price is fair.  Way better than anything you'd get at Specialty's for same price.  Excellent chicken.  Mealpal is a great way to enjoy as you skip line and save a little.
author: Marc S.

description: This place is amazing, a real San Franciscan gem! Very healthy Mexican options from salad to bowls.  The service is really what makes it next level. Everyone is friendly and very helpful (plus it's quick) reasonably priced salad and burrito bowl for only 7.95.
author: Kelly N.

description:
Pretty good food, and ingredients, and packaged better than Chipotle. However, the chicken bone frag was an unexpected bonus (bone-us?) item. This wasn't nearly as traumatic as when the other poster found a carnitas bone the "hard" way, because no mere chicken bone is gonna crack my enamel. But it's still not pleasant to bite into your food and find something that can cut your mouth.

Since this is the 2nd post regarding bones, might be time to look into the deboning process. I wouldn't want this spot's reputation to get ...fractured.
author: J S.

description:
I had gone by this place a million times, but never gone in because the line is always insanely long - so I made a mental not "must be good, gotta try". The issue was when... Then yesterday I had a very late lunch so I walked over to Cantina Verde and there was no line. Score!

Just like others have said this is Chipotle with more options - and so far no ecoli ;-)

You start with what you want (taco or burrito or whatever), then move on to what you want on it ans you move through the station. I had the carne asada taco (3). They were fresh and yummy. 

Will be back for a late lunch soon.
author: Massimo M.

description:
This place is a hidden gem in the financial district! Just go after 2 pm to avoid the lunch rush if you can, it gets a bit hectic down there! 

Suelia (Spelling may be wrong) was super helpful and sweet! Actually everyone who was there was pretty chill! 

I had a Chicken with Cilantro and Lime Burrito and the way that the Burrito was toasted and folded was just like how my buddy's mom used to do it for us back home in Texas! 

I also had the best Fresca Juice Ever! The Strawberry and Watermelon juice was to die for! Plus, they told me how fresh the food was when I cam in and it was vibrant and colorful and not like a cheesy or run down salad bar thing. I love that it looked so clean and fresh and they were so friendly and helpful! I was in a good mood when I walked in so I think that might of had something to do with it. 

The burrito was not soggy or anything and it was filled all the way to the end and like a bunch of tortilla at the bottom like other places! I wish more people made it their burritos like this. 

They are closed weekends which is a big bummer for me but I make it down there for a burrito about once a week now and they are probably my favrite place for a burrito in the City right now.
author: Adam G.

description: This is my go-to place for a quick lunch. The line is always so long, but it moves pretty fast. I like it better than chipotle because you have more variety in your meats and veggies, and the salsa is delicious (and spicy!). I also love that they offer whole wheat tortillas, chipotle doesn't!
author: Trishna P.

description:
Cantina verde is lovely Mexican outlet with good options of Mexican food like burritos n salads with includes of veg n non veg. For selecting salad bowl we can have our own options to have a salad and its yummy and healthy option too. Avocado is one of the famous fruit which is in green but not so tasty for me. But it's a good option to have in salad bowl. Along with bowl I had jarritos in tamarind drink it's a quite new to me and better than artificial drink. Finally a good visit.

Store is quite clean and always popped up with crowd from 12-2 , they have quite limited seats to dine in. Staff is terrific in explaining the menu.
author: Sandeep R.

description: I'm giving this one star because the service was quick. My chicken bowl was ice cold, only got about 1/4 cup of rice and chicken had gristle on it. The black beans were okay. The place is a wanna be Chipolte. I won't be back.
author: Sharan D.

description: Great food, friendly service and body moving music make this a great local lunch spot. I'll certainly be back for lunch and any of our future company catering needs .
author: Roberta G.

description: the house salad they gave me today was missing 2 of the  ingredients.  corn and avocado
author: Richard M.

description: If I'm craving a Mexican/taco-style salad or looking for a breakfast burrito (with chorizo) to last me through the day, Verde is my spot! It's reliable, consistent, and my choice for salads (more lettuce options and toppings) and breakfast burritos (chorizo! yay!) when compared to Chipotle or other fast casual Mexican spots. Many times, I'll get the salad with just lime instead of dressing. The chicken is so flavorful that you don't really need the additional calories in a vinaigrette or creamy sauce. You can get a meal for less than $10 that will keep you full for the rest of the day. The components taste like they're cooked fresh daily and the employees always serve you with a smile. Finally, my favorite part about the burrito is that they automatically toast it for you (crisping the tortilla and softening the cheese).
author: Tammy T.

description: The food here is very yummy. I like to eat it. The staff is very nice to me. There are tables there so there is a place to sit and I can eat it there. They also allow me to take food to-go which is nice. The food is very healthy so I will be strong after I eat it. They have a lot of vegetarian options so I don't have to eat animals.
author: Ken K.

description:
I don't think you can get a salad better than this!  I joined Mealpal in SF.  For about $5.11 a day, you get 12 days a month to try different restaurants form a group of menu choices for the day.  They have other plans for 30 days or less days.  That is how I found Cantina Verde.  I have to say that this is the best salad yet - fresh and tasty...  great lettuce, avocado, beans, spiced jicama, great chicken (grilled and seasoned) and a fabulous southwest dressing that was not too little or too much.  It was a large salad and I won't be hungry anytime soon.  I will definitely go back.  I looked up the calories online and it is 600 for this salad - well worth it!  Ole!
I should add that it is hard to find - around the corner from the listed address of 398 Market Street...  look for the sign on the sidewalk - shown in one of these pictures...
author: Winston O.

description: This place used to be my go-to! They are a little more stingy on the portions now and the new staff isn't as friendly as the prior ones. The man with the mustache who I assume is the owner/manager is great but hardly there now. :(
author: Eve C.

description:
SO FAR I'M A FAN
(4 stars)

Just another boring FiDi food review. Skip if you please.

-FOOD, good
-PRICES, affordable
-SERVICE, quick
-AMBIANCE, like chipotle but better

Why is it so difficult to find a decent salad (that's healthy), preferably not costing an arm and a leg, in the FiDi? Don't think this place is about burritos because it's not. The line moves fast. The concept is very much like Chipotle BUT FRESHER AND MORE SELECTIONS. Different rice, different taste in their meats, and a variety of add-ons at the end. When real Mexican-Americans make your food, Mexican music playing in the background... you get that "Mexican" feel with the "Chipotle" flair.

HEIFER STATS.

SALAD BOWL ($6.50) - that's a decent price for salad in FiDi. Choice of mixed greens or lettuce. Chose mixed greens. Jalapeno white rice or cilantro brown rice. i'm a sucker for cilantro - went with cilantro brown rice. I rarely eat (red) meat and went for carne asada/steak for protein (hitting the gym hard after work), skipped on a bunch of roasted veggies and added the roasted zucchinis, JICAMA (wow what a great selection for salad add-ons), dabble of shredded cheese, and chose the cilantro vinaigrette (although i'm not adding any to the actual salad). The portions are great for one really hungry person or two semi-hungry people.

GUACOMOLE & CHIPS ($3) - typical tortilla chips. The guac. is really good here. I'm not sure how or what was mixed in but it was just tasty. 

WATERMELON FRESCA - refreshing. Starting to feel like summer. 


Will I be back? Sure why not.

Until the next review...
author: Jane A.

description:
The price point makes them a winner when compared to Chipotle. I went with the bowl but the salad looked big when compared to their competitors  
Fresh ingredients and a couple more add on choices like fresh jalapeños and mushrooms. I think they had some sauteed fries looking potatoes? too. The fresca was good
Definitely has potential.
Will go back again
author: Sam K.

description: Second day of MealPass, and I was praying to the FiDi salad gods that they would deliver unto me a better salad than the one I had the day before. I ordered the Fiesta Salad at Cantina Verde, and it was just middle-of-the-road lunchtime fare. The salad was a better size and had more vegetables, but the cheese melted in a pretty unappetizing way (see picture). It had a good amount of chicken, though, so that was nice. Nothing special, but giving this a solid 3.
author: Shayna M.

description:
Was so happy to see this place open up right across from my office building.  It's like a healthier spin on Chipotle.  You have your choice of burrito, tacos, and salad bowls with grilled chicken, carnitas (braised pork), carne asada (grilled steak), grilled & roasted vegetables and even braised TOFU. Wow!

I came here for breakfast today after I saw that it had newly opened about a week ago.  I got a breakfast burrito it was so delicious! I really loved the fact that you have a choice of flour or wheat tortilla.  You also had a choice of regular eggs or using egg whites.  I wasn't going to put any sausage or bacon but couldn't resist when I smelled the chicken apple sausage and the bacon and was able to get half and half.  Had some chipotle to top the burrito which gave it that extra umph! It was very filling. 
 
The owner was giving complimentary green juice, he said it has spinach, ginger, apples, pineapple it tasted refreshing and I felt healthier just drinking it. 
 
The place is clean and well maintained.  I am sure it is going to do really well because their ingredients are good and they put together good and healthy simple Mexican fare.  Four stars!
author: Maria M.

description: good food but again w/meal pal since they make alot of the same thing for those meal pal customers the product isn't as great.
author: Tasha D.

description: Yummy food especially there breakfast burritos! I've heard good things about there catering as well. I'll have to try them. Very friendly staff. Will go back again.
author: Roxy Z.

description: This place has really good fresh food but it is so unfortunate that they purposely give the smallest portion so that they can force to pay extra for everything. Every time I go there they give you less and less. Not paying for their food anymore. Chipotle is so much better at give you the portion you are paying for.
author: Caitlin M.

description:
It's not on Market Street so the address is confusing.  It's on the corner of Pine and Front.

I had the carnitas burrito on whole wheat tortilla, with black beans, brown rice,  cheese, grilled onions and mushrooms.

All I could do was point at what looked good. Nothing is labeled so I felt I wasn't able to get exactly what I wanted and probably missed something.  

I thought the price was fair and I shared the burrito and it filled us both up. But I probably wont go back
author: Foodlover B.

description:
We came by this location - mostly because it was a coworker suggested it being a better alternative to Chipotle. It's a bit further from work, but honestly, I'm always up for a good walk around Fidi. 

I ordered the verde house salad: romaine lettuce, chipotle chicken, black beans, sweet corn, chili dusted jicama, cherry tomatoes, cotija cheese, hard boiled egg, tortilla chips, and avocado. with homemade chipotle dressing - and it was delicious. I think there could be some tweaks to the salad, but it was pretty good otherwise. Always ask for the dressing on the side because you can then track how much you're using rather than what they're putting in. 

The next time I went I got a burrito bowl. Similar to the bowls at chipotle, you can choose what to go in it. Not in love with the process since it was a little too quick especially since I've always gotten the bowls at Chiptole. 

Protip: the salads are great!
author: Nina Y.

description:
Sometimes the financial district of San Francisco reminds me of cable tv. All these channels I flip through on my remote, and there's nothing I'm interested in watching. That's how I feel as I aimlessly walk down each street in the financial district. Sure there are places to eat but nothing that I'm interested in eating at the moment. There's only so many Subway sandwiches, Lee's deli, and McMuffins I can eat before I want something new or different.

Cantina Verde provides a niche that is a refreshing change from the usual. The other day I passed by Verde and decided to try them out. They have regular burritos for lunch but I arrived around 7am. So the only option of course is a breakfast burrito.

So the friendly lady that makes the burrito asked me which wrap I preferred, wheat or flour tortilla. Then I got one choice of meat, vegetable, eggs, salsa, and sour cream which they actually charge an extra 50 cents for which is kind of nickel n' dime'ing in my opinion.

Overall I thought the burrito was a tasty, good-sized breakfast for $6.47 total. Would I go back again? Absolutely. It's a good option in a area filled with options I don't want. Now where's my remote??
author: Michael L.

description:
Hmm, I a bit undecided on where to rate Cantina Verde, so I'll do 3 stars and update this if something bumps things up a bit to 4 stars.  I'm rating this a 3.5.

I'm going to base my rating on a comparison to Chipotle.  I would rate Chipotle 3 stars as well.

The food at Cantina Verde tastes better.  I like the meat (carnitas in particular) better here.  I also like the flavors of the salsas better and I like the grilled peppers much better.  They also have a bit more variety here, but the menu is a little confusing and it is hard to figure out what is included and what costs extra and they don't really do a great job explaining it.

6.95 is your base cost for tacos, a burrito, a bowl etc.

Unlike Chipotle, you only get cheese or sour cream.  If you get a bowl, you can't get a tortilla or taco shells on the side, that is also extra.

They also don't fill the bowls up as much as Chipotle.

The guacamole is less expensive here and I did not have the chips.  A co-worker said that they did not like the chips very much.

Cantina Verde does have more options of things you can put in your burrito, but they all cost extra for the most part.  Make sure you check before you add something unless you are ballin and don't care.  If that is the case, add whatever your heart desires.

They also have agua fresca available, but I haven't tried them.

They have Dr. Pepper as a fountain soda option, thumbs up for that one.

From the reviews I read, they recently raised their prices up from 6.45 to 6.95.  It still isn't bad at 6.95, but 6.45 is better.  :)

From what I've read the breakfast burritos are pretty good, so maybe I'll have to check that out one of these days.
author: Ty C.

description:
Imagine Chipotle only with a ton more custom options. They offer up an array of veggies/sauces and proteins to please anyone + 2 options for tortilla (wheat or flour).

The burrito was filling but felt all the ingredients lacked flavor and salt. With a little adjustment I feel it could be more worth wild then going to Chipotle. 

Overall Thoughts

Chipotle might have some competition after all
author: Eddie W.

description:
I like this place because it has so many more options than its rival, Chipotle. The price is decent... or should I say the BASE price is decent. They really nickle and dime you for the ingredients that blatantly say "NO CHARGE" on the menu... First of all, they are REALLY stingy with their toppings, so when I asked for a little extra cheese on my burrito bowl, I was then charged 50 cents for "Extra Dairy" (as the employee wrote on top of my lid). I was so confused as to why I was being charged extra for "No Charge" toppings.... Makes no sense at all. Not to mention the mean scowl the woman gave me when I asked for a little more. Yes, lady, you are an inadequate scooper and I like more than 6 strands of cheese... deal with it.

It honestly put a bad taste in my mouth (no pun intended) after I left, that I'm not sure I feel like coming back. Which is a shame because I came here often and this is a new development in recent weeks. I realize it's /only/ 50 cents, but it's more about the principle. 

No charge should mean no charge. If that isn't the case, update your menu to reflect the correct prices.
author: Kelly E.

description:
Cantina Verde is a restaurant located in the Financial District of SF between Beale and Fremont right off Market Street on Pine Street. This is one of the restaurants offered on MealPass (now MealPal) that sold what looked like a healthy salad, which is exactly what I was looking for for lunch on my visit.

FREQUENCY: I've ordered at this establishment three times.

FOOD: Cantina Verde offers a pretty hefty salad. It's pretty rare that I get a salad for lunch and am not hungry for something else two hours later. The salad kept me satisfied until I got home for dinner. The ingredients all tasted fresh and made for a good lunch. I've been three times now because whenever I'm looking for something healthy that I know will also be a real meal, Cantina Verde seals the deal.

DRINK: I have never ordered any drinks while at this establishment since I'm always ordering and then bringing the food back to my work place. As with any restaurant I assume they have the standard assortment of fountain drinks and water.

ATMOSPHERE: Cantina Verde has a pretty standard made-to-order style atmosphere. I wouldn't say anything unique or special stands out about it. But at the same time I can say nothing bad about it which is a win in my book. Pro tip: the line can get very long so try and get there for lunch early.

STAFF: I've only ever talked to the staff when picking up my food. Every time the staff has been incredibly polite during the quick process.

PAYMENT: Credit cards or cash were acceptable.

I haven't had anything but the house salad so I can't say much as to whether or not Cantina Verde will blow you mind food wise. I think I'll have to stop by another time and see what else they offer on their menu. But that aside, if you want a decent salad that will definitely fill you up given the portion size then Cantina Verde is a good stop. A recommended place for lunch in the Financial District.
author: Christopher D.

description: They rushed me so fast through that assembly line that I didn't get what I wanted. All I needed was an extra 20 seconds to elaborate what I wanted as my toppings. My order now has missing lettuce but they gave me the ever-so-hated cilantro. Hard to palate.
author: Julie L.

description:
A solid three stars. Satisfied my rainy day hunger pangs. I walk by this place every day to and from work and always considered it to be similar to Chipotle. I came in during an off hour around 4:30. Kinda random that they close at 5 on weekdays, but I suppose since they are open for breakfast, it's a push.

I ordered a carne asada burrito and though it was so-so. Smaller than I expected, and the meat was pretty dry, but overall the taste was good. I know this had a lot to do with the chipotle salsa I doused over each bite. Also, please give free chips. For an almost $9 burrito, come on. Who is with me?!

Not sure I'd race back in, but considering there are very few Mexican spots near my office and apartment, who knows, maybe I will.
author: Brianna M.

description:
It's average. The food needed salt. This cannot compete with my taqueria pancho villa.

Ordered carnitas 
Avocado
Pico de gallo
Veggies
Cheese 
grilled onions

Need gravy
Or
Something to flavor it with.


Salsa was ok

Also
Why is there food not hot but lukewarm.
I ain't digging that.
author: Charlene C.

description: Stingy Chipotle clone. I don't like rice and prefer beans. These guys are like the Soup Nazis. Another scoop of beans and they want to charge you. Everything is really extra. Order the tacos and you'll get almost nada on them for the same inflated price. They pretend it's your way but it's nothing of the sort. The people are likewise brainless and not customer service oriented. Very low quality experience. Save your $$ and go to a real Mexican establishment not some corporate fast food cultural appropriation.
author: Eric M.

description:
The carne needs more time in the asadafier.  

They'll give you real jalapenos, so that puts it ahead of a lot of the crap food around here.
author: Jared L.

description: Just used a gratis MealPal from a friend for their house salad.  Man, was that satisfying and yummy!  Filling, spicy, delicious!
author: Donna H.

description:
New work office location = finding a new place for breakfast burritos.
Cantina Verde doesn't disappoint! HUGE breakfast burritos for $4.95. Choice of wheat or white tortilla, choice of egg whites or regular eggs, choice of meat, and choice of toppings incl fajita veggies/beans/potatoes/salsa/etc. 
Breakfast hours are 7-10a.

I also stopped in for lunch and their bowls are pretty good as well. Good portions for a small price.
author: Angela D.

description: This is the best place in FiDi (Financial District). They are so well priced and you get a ton TON of food. Especially the salads. I come here often and will continue to
author: Michael J.

description:
We all are guilty of putting a person on bootycall status once in our lives.  And we all are guilty of putting a so-so place on bootycall status when we are too lazy to go all the way to the original place we want.  So would Cantina Verde be a bootycall for Chipotle?

I was grabbing lunch with a friend nearby (Chipotle is actually closer to my office) and we decided to check out to Cantina Verde. I decided on a burrito bowl and she got a salad.  While CV gives you more options with fillings the rice is so much better at Chipotle!  Fillings include: mixed veggies, mushrooms.  The menu however isn't clear, like I wanted some mixed veggies instead, but they told me I couldn't get any more toppings because it only includes 4.  The carnitas was fine, but I felt like my dish was a little on the bland side, and unlike Chipotle they don't have some assorted hot sauces on the side to top it with.  My burrito bowl was about $7, so more or less slightly cheaper than Chipotle.  Line gets long during the lunch rush but moves quick enough.  Would I go back?  Maybe if I wanted something Chipotle like & was closer to it than Chipotle.  Maybe I should try one of their much talked about breakfast burritos if I'm nearby one day.
author: Cat C.

description: My favorite foto lunch.  Long line goes very quickly.  Staff are super friendly and make my day brighter with their quick chat.    The food is super fresh, excellent ingredients and fantastic price.  Can not recommend this lunch spot enough.  Six stars!!
author: Annette M.

description: I love the verde house salad here. I get it for Meal pal almost every week. The quantity is really good and the salad is fresh and tasty.
author: Haritha M.

description:
This is basically the pumped up version of Chipotle. Fresh ingredients, large portions, and it's delicious! I got the cantina verde featured salad! You can choose romaine lettuce OR mixed greens! Ask for mixed greens, if they just hand you romaine. 

I also substituted the tortilla chips for mushrooms! The salad was really tasty, and you can shake it up with the dressing inside of the box! 

Glad this is an easy option around! $8.16 was the total for the verde salad! :D
author: Joanna S.

description:
obsessed!!!! eat here almost every day
$6.50 (edit: they just raised to $6.95 over the weekend :P) for MOUNDS of delicious Mexican tastiness
I go for the romaine salad with tofu (or chicken)
if you get tofu, you get 3 additional roasted veggies
then the cheeses
then the salsas
then all the raw veggies
the jalapenos, don't forget your jalapenos
then the dressing
so good so good so good!!!

i hope they get a loyalty card ^_^
author: Kristal N.

description: Fresh food peppered at break neck speed... Perfect for a rushed lunchtime meal that is healthy and well priced. It has huge lines that move very quickly so don't be put off of the line is out the door (which it often is and for good reason!) very similar to Chipotle but fresher cheaper faster and bigger.  Highly recommend the ochata
author: Robbie M.

description:
Price is now the same as Chipotle, but Chipotle tastes a lot better.

The last two times I had their salads, I had a mild case of the runs, don't think I'll be coming back.

Notes:
- Warm toppings on cold salad greens = unappetizing
- Their cooked vegetables always kind of give me that oily after-taste in my mouth (no bueno) and the zucchini & squash don't go well in a bowl. Who thought of this? They're always super watery b/c of the mushrooms too. 
- Their black beans seem like they come straight out of the can, just heated.. meh
- Their salsas leave something to be desired
author: Emily C.

description: This was my first time visiting as I was picking up an order for my co-worker. As I watched the nice lady make this enormous breakfast burrito I couldn't help but want one too. I ordered a chorizo and bacon breakfast burrito and not only was it feeling... It was good as hell! I'll be back for sure!
author: A. C.

description:
Just another FiDi lunch place review...

Plant Organic's line was just insane so we crossed the street over to Cantina Verde. 

Since everyone is making the Chipotle comparison I guess I'll follow suit. I'm not really a huge fan of Chipotle but they surely have this place beat in the taste department. The flavors here just were not there. A small dash of salt would go a long way and it looks like I'm not the only one who has noticed the lack of taste in their food. 

I did however enjoy the fresca but only because I tend to like it not too sweet. Free refills. 

Mexican cuisine is pretty flavorful and somehow this placed managed to make it bland.
author: Esther A.

description: Fun new place in the FiDi with some really friendly staff!  It's Chipotle-esque concept is definitely not original, but hey, sometimes you need a change.  And, sometimes I just don't want to wait in the REALLY long line either.  So, Cantina Verde was a great place when I was in a hurry and in need of a customizable lunch.  I will definitely be coming back, I especially like all of their toppings and add-ons, with the exception of charging for teeny avocado slices.  Meh. That aside, I really like this place!
author: Lisa I.

description:
Awesome budget lunch spot :) for 7 bucks you get a big fat burrito or a big box of salad. 

It's a better version of chipotle - can't expect it taste like really Mexican food but I love the fresh ingredients that they offer. It's healthier. 

It's usually packed during lunch hours so I go there in the late afternoon. 

The staff are friendly and efficient.
author: Sophia S.

description:
This is one of my usual lunch spots. People are complaining that this is a Chipotle knock off and its not authentic but what do you expect when you order a burrito or a salad. It is similar to Chipotle but there are some notable flavor differences, in my opinion better. 

I usually order a burrito with chipotle chicken, white rice, black beans, bell peppers, cotija cheese (a salty cheese which maybe why I love this place so much) and chipotle salsa. 

Sometimes, the lady sprinkles cheese and salsa which is a little annoying. The guy at the front is very nice and friendly. He is saving grace of the customer service
author: Cindy C.

description:
I am a bit of a breakfast burrito fanatic.  I used to get my fix at Un Dos Tacos until I found a long, thick black hair in my burrito a couple of weeks ago.  I have tried Caramba and Rico Mex since then.  They were okay, but nothing to write home about.  

Then today I decided to get off BART at Embarcadero because I was restless after a stop and go ride and remembered that I had read that Cantina Verde was open for breakfast.  The overall reviews I read were mixed, but the ones about the breakfast burritos seemed mostly positive. 

I am SO glad that I decided to try Cantina Verde this morning.  I have now found my go to breakfast burrito place.  It was a bit more expensive than the ones closer to my office, but a lot bigger and SO MUCH tastier.  Rather than nickel and dime you for each add on, they charge a flat $5.95 plus tax for all the fixings you want (other than avocado or guacamole).  You get eggs or egg whites, choice of meat (carne asada, chorizo, sausage, or bacon), choice of beans (black or pinto), choice of salsas (you can get as many and as much salsa as you want - green, red, or pico de gallo), plus you can add grilled peppers and/or onions, and/or mushrooms, potatoes, as well as cheese and/or sour cream.

I went with eggs, chorizo, black beans, green and red salsa, grilled peppers, potatoes, and cheese.  It was one of the best tasting breakfast burritos I've ever had, and I was full for over five hours.  It was more brunch than breakfast.
author: Vanessa P.

description:
Overall, I'm a fan of this place.  Yes, it's a blatant copy of Chipotle, but the food is a bit better and seems fresher.  The cilantro lime chicken is a favorite.

Some of the items are really salty, which is why I knocked off a star.  I also wish they had spanish rice, not just white and brown.
author: Steve B.

description:
It was 12:45pm today and I had a hankering for a quesadilla! I've had quesadillas there before and they are pretty good. I waited in line for almost 15 minutes and it was finally my turn...I was so excited because I was starving at that point. I get to the front, and the man who is always the first guy in the line, asks what I would like. I politely asked for a quesadilla. He huffed and puffed and said, "it's too busy to make a quesadilla. We don't make them between 12 and 2." WTH!!! I waited in line for 15 minutes for that answer?! Nowhere does it state that in the place! If I had known, I wouldn't have wasted my time waiting in line. I was astonished and just left. Chipotle has much longer lines, and they are never "too busy" to make me a quesadilla. I will never go back there. In the amount of time the guy huffed and puffed, he could have made me a quesadilla! 

They forever lost my business to Chipotle. I can always count on Chipotle.
author: Monica C.

description:
I'm horrified it took me so long to update my lukewarm review. The issues have been resolved and this place is now far superior to Chipotle, at least for my purposes. A few points:

1) They actually know how to cook and season beans correctly.

2) They selection of veggies you can add to your order is really not something I've seen anywhere else. It's almost a cross between Chipotle and Mixt Greens in that regard.

3) Fresh avocado slices!

4) The habanero sauce... oh my god, so hot; so good. And if you ask them, they will smother your meal in it. 

5) Everything just seems fresher than Chipotle... it's really hard to put your finger on, but it's the case. 

I love this place.
author: Logan B.

description: I love this place. Fresh, amazing food and even if the line is long at lunch, it moves pretty quick. Staff are always helpful and courteous. One of my favorite lunch spots.
author: Jessica X.

description:
For at least the first 3 days this place was opened, they served free breakfast and lunch. I went in for one of the breakfasts and got a legit breakfast burrito. 1. It was big 2. It wasn't generic 3.I had the option of getting egg white,  real avocados, and wheat tortilla.  A Healthy, delcious breakfast burrito!? I have died and gone to heaven.
On top of that the employees were sooo friendly and so nice. They were giving us free burritos, they didn't expect a tip, and they were genuinely smiley and genuinely nice. 
I love you, Cantina Verde. And I am so glad that you are across the street from my work. Now I have an alternative for that overly priced Plant.
author: Julianna I.

description: Great food... found this place while shopping and decided to give it a try. I'm glad I did because the food is fresh, tasty and health. I definitely will be back. I give it 5 stars...
author: G R.

description: This place has the best, freshest ingredients. Made to order, always super fast friendly service. I eat here at least once a week.
author: Justin Z.

description: Hands down better than Chipotle! You can taste the freshness in their ingredients and they have better sides. I love how they have mushrooms, different cheeses, and jalapenos. The portions aren't huge like Chipotle but it's cheaper so you're still getting a bang for your buck. The line is always long, but it moves fairly quickly.
author: Irma R.

description:
I ordered 2 bowls and 1 burrito. It's true what the others have said.   The music was loud so you have to shout for the staff to hear you over the glass panel.  The lady in front of me kept saying, don't leave my tortilla in the heater too long I don't want it crispy.  She must have said it three time until I couldn't take it any longer and shouted her directions to the staff member. 

Anyway, they should really think about investing in slotted spoons for the beans because when they scooped them up, they took a lot of the water and that soaked the burrito and nearly decomposed the paper bowls.  Really, they should think about investing in either slotted spoons or aluminum bowls.   Chipotle got it right with the aluminum bowls.

They were cheap with the protein but generous with the veggies but again, we have the soggy, decomposing issue. 

Another thing, I asked for 2 soft tortillas so I can make my own wrap from th bowl. The worker repeated "2" but she only gave me one. What gives?

It was ok but not as good as Chipotle.
author: Wendy H.

description: This house salad is becoming addictive! I'm about to brave the rain and head back to my office...but not without this yummy salad. It's the only thing I consistently get here as I find "down home" Mexican goodness at competitive restaurants closer to Mission, but as far as salads go, I'm sold!
author: Maria S.

description: A great alternative to Chipotle. I always get the salad,  and the portion here is much larger. The carne asada here is a little drier, but the chicken was good. There are TONS more toppings here. It's not immediately obvious which toppings are free, so be sure to ask them. Another reviewer commented on a lack of labels and a feeling of being rushed--this was definitely true. The price was like $7.50 for base price of anything, but $8.50 if you want carne asada. Great deal, great food, and you will get your food very quickly. I will definitely be returning.
author: Richard L.

description:
This place is an amazing gem. 

Their lunch menu is pretty typical of an establishment like this and has many similarities with that of Chipotle, except you have a few more choices in meat and can top off additionally here without ridiculous pricing.

What I really want to emphasize here and place in focus is their breakfast menu. I am a big fan of their breakfast burritos here. The staff they have in the morning is extremely chipper and they brighten up my day. Along with the most humongous burrito for $5.99 with my choice of meat and either regular eggs or egg whites. 

I have not been able to finish a breakfast burrito here. I usually split it and have half for breakfast and half for lunch.

If you're on a budget in the FIDI but need a power breakfast to carry you on through the evening this is the spot. It's a no fail because the combination of great service with a smile and awesome food make it a seller!
author: Ryan C.

description: Cantina Verde reminds me a lot of Chipotle in all the good ways.  Great and fresh selection of meat and sides.  There was a line out the door so you know they have to be on to something.  I got a bowl with the chipotle chicken and it was really good.  If it was closer to my place I'd come here more often.
author: Blake B.

description:
Yes it is similar to Chipotale style but few different choices. 
For example, you have mushroom/zucchini -squash along with bell papers.  They offer chunks of tofu plus choice of wheat tortillas. Avocados are considered as prime item and can cost extra $1 here. 
I have tried tofu burrito/bowl with 3 free vegetables few times. I liked the variation and found it very nice.
While ordering pay attention to 'No Charge items' and avoid using word 'extra' ;)
 If you stick to defaults, then it cost you 6.95$ with good portion to eat.  Some servers do inform you about extra charge if you choose unconventional path. They also offer signature salad at 7.95$. Salad seems to more popular here and will try some time.
author: Sunny G.

description:
Worse ingredients, worse food, Cantina Verde. 

Chipotle me-too restaurant with little flavor. 
I had the Steak (beef) Burrito on a whole wheat tortilla. 
 - Tortilla was unsteamed; Beef actually ok. 
Included was pinto beans, cheese, guac, fresca and hot salsas. 
- Plain, needed salt and spice. Clearly corporate culture voiding all flavor. 

Would go to Chipotle as an alternative. 
Would go to Tlaloc by choice.
author: Chris S.

description:
Further from my office than Chiptole, but comparable. My friend and I were the VERY LAST people they let in during their opening week of free food. We both ordered the burrito bowl, he had already been in for the breakfast burrito and said it was very good. 

Pros: Lots of options for additions: guac or sliced avocados, sauteed veggies, tofu.    I'm not sure if they up-charge for things like guacamole since it was free at the time. They give a large portion of beans and meat, which is important to me. Everything is the same price $6.50 for 3 tacos, a burrito, a burrito bowl, or a salad.

Cons: The salsa was not spicy, the rice was undercooked, there was no lettuce to top off the bowl (maybe because we were the last people), the staff was not trained on what was what in the array of food, and the guy making my bowl put soo much sour cream and advised that the red salsa was spicy (as noted, it was not).

They certainly have some kinks to work out, but it's a starting business so it's very understandable. It's probably hard to compete with all the places in the FiDi, and it's going to be hard to beat Chipotle's limesalt chips. I will certainly be back to try again. Good luck Cantina Verde!
author: Crystal C.

description: No. On the surface this places look innovative and delicious, but it IS a ripoff of chipotle and really not enough flavors in their ingredients. Portions are small where are you're bowl is half empty, bland, and ultimately unsatisfactory. U get like 2 ingredients before you are charged extra! There's plenty of other bowl/burrito joints nearby so for this one I'll pass.
author: Daniel T.

description:
