This is where all my money would go every day for lunch.

Thoroughly enjoyed the salads here. Salad portions are huge and only cost ~$9. Customer service is EXCELLENT. Line moves fairly quickly. I also love how they have fresh jalapenos.

Minus one star for possibly giving me food poisoning. Since I probably ate other questionable things that day, the 4 star rating stays.
author: T L.

description: I wanted a light breakfast, little did I realize I was getting a gut bomb which was rather expensive for breakfast. I just wanted a simple taco, but they don't have this so I got the burrito bowl which was massive and filling. None of the items in the bowl were particularly great, but they weren't horrible either. Might as well go to Chipotle for better food, which is also a meh...
author: Jonah K.

description:
Great service + fresh food. Great spot for vegetarians and vegans. Items are customizable and there are great veggie options.

The food is well priced at Verde. You can get a filling salad for under $8.00. Their breakfast servings are very filling as well.  

Finally everything at Verde is very clean - you'll want to take a seat and eat here.

Say 'hi' to Alex who is always working with a friendly disposition and the efficiency to keep the line moving and food tasty.
 
Enjoy!
author: Maude B.

description:
Went here with my coworkers for a lunch break around noon. Hectic as always, the line snaked around the corner in a what seemed like an irritatingly long line. Luckily, this didn't prove to be true. 

We were able to quickly pass through, almost too fast tho, as I barely had time to dither between all the different fresh options -avocado, black beans, corn, overwhelming array of choices- I ended up getting a house salad with everything on it upon my coworkers advice. 

A great choice! Paired with my sandia agua fresca, it made for a refreshing and (what I hope was) healthy meal. It was great for the price, a pretty hefty amount of salad with good chicken breast to jicama to corn ratio. Don't forget to squeeze a lime!

Overall, not bad food, seating was limited, but I was prepared for it. Definitely a convenient and solid stop if you're in a hurry and don't feel like trekking over to chipotle.
author: Oliver C.

description: Been eating here for quite a while. Basically Imagine if Chipotle wasn't as horrible for you. The meat is much better quality and I love their red and green sauce. Big lines at lunch just like everything else, but I would defenetly say it is worth it.
author: Ozzy I.

description: They increased the size of the salad close to it's original quantity...Still not to where it was initially but pretty​ close
author: Sanam H.

description:
Seeing that the place look clean and always packed with people, I thought: "Okay, I will give it a try".  After all, what could possibly go wrong?

A lot could go wrong, as I found out.

This place felt like a mildly upgraded Chipotle, and I must say that I was quite impressed initially.  My first bite into my carnitas burrito was aromatic and full of flavor, that I actually vowed to never go back to Chipotle again!  But something bothered me... Something...  (crunch crunch).  Oh yeah, the rice was under-cooked and crunchy.

Few things bother me more than crunchy rice. Seriously, rice is not that difficult to cook. To make it crunchy is just inexcusable. A bit more water and a few minutes longer in the steamer would've been nice. For the rest of my burrito, I just could not shake my hatred against the crunchy rice and focus on the nicely marinated pulled pork (carnitas).

Then, there's also the kitchen... It was nice and clean at first glance. But I made the mistake of sitting at the bar/counter in front of the kitchen, and witnessed the horrors that goes on in that kitchen first hand. 

First off, the chef cleaned the grill with a short-bristle broom.
"Surely it was a special grill cleaner!" You protest.
No, it was a broom. With a long handle. Designed for sweeping.
"Then it must be used only for cleaning the grill and kept clean!" You suggest.
No. It went back down to the floor after use. With the bristle end on the floor!

Then, there's the bucket of murky water used for cleaning EVERYTHING.
"Oh come'on, it was for the counter top only!" You defended them.
Nope. It cleaned the cutting board as well.
"Then it was only for cleaning fully cooked stuff!" You yelled.
Nope. It wiped up blood and marinating juice from raw meat containers too.

To be fair, most restaurants probably would be guilty of the same shenanigans. But those restaurants do them behind the door, out of sight. They don't do this in plain sight to gross people out. Seriously. Bucket of yuck here!

I don't want to be mean about it and give this place only one star. After all, it's not like they molested my dog and set my jacket on fire out of malice or something like that. But the poorly trained kitchen staff who decided to put on a terrifying display for everyone to witness, and the carelessly prepared rice that was supposed to be fluffy but ended up crunchy made me wishing to never come back again.

Such a pity... The carnitas really was quite tasty.
author: James W.

description:
I'm a regular here :)

The house salad is bomb.

I ned to try other stuff as well
author: P D.

description: Fresh and better flavor a than Chipotle. I think they have more options as well and the price is really reasonable. The staff has always been nice the times I have gone in there.
author: Ayana K.

description: I always get the salad here. It's pretty hearty and decent quality. The salad dressings are good too. The amount of ingredients is a little haphazard but it's a great lunch option for the area if you don't want to spend $10+ that's common in the Embarcadero area. Maybe some time I'll try the burrito bowls or burritos.
author: Elsie M.

description: Had a huge caterpillar in my salad. No one should eat at a restaurant with this kind of hygiene and quality control.
author: Angie R.

description: Great Mexican to go spot. It's like Chipotle but cheaper with the salad option. I especially like the fact that they have jicama. Their line is not too bad and moves quick. $7.60 for a carnitas salad is fair/reasonable.
author: Tracy L.

description:
Plagiarism is the sincerest form of flattery. As a Chinese guy who's been to the mother land of knock-offs, I can always appreciate a quality replica when I see one. Who wouldn't want a Bolex watch or a Sorny TV =P  ? While many have referred the newcomer, Cantina Verde, as a copycat Chipotle or 'Fake Chipotle' as my co-workers have coined, the subtle additions that Cantina Verde offer, makes it very distinguishable. Does Cantina Verde borrow a concept or two from Chiptole? Sure. A simple menu of the traditional burrito, burrito bowl, salad and tacos, all customizable to your taste and preferences. Comparable price point. Quick in and out service. But it's the plethora of additional veggie options and variations of proteins that make Cantina Verde a worthwhile experience, even for the biggest Chipotle loyalists. 

I crammed my burrito bowl with white and brown rice, two types of chicken, no beans (musical fruit), fajita style bell peppers, zucchini, mushrooms, mild salsa, avocado, tomatoes, corn, two different types of cheese and lettuce. A titanic work of art so large the lid would not contain all of the goodness. An amazing lunch for $7.50 (avocado was $1 extra) 

Plus:

- Chipotle is two blocks further than Cantina Verde
- Lines move much slower at Chipotle, which creates longer lines
author: Mike L.

description:
With Chipotle and the authentic Tlaloc Sabor Mexicano restaurants nearby, this place still shined. A chipotle ordering style system but with more interesting and flavorful ingredients. This place is amazing and you can't beat the price. Not to mention aquas frescas for under 2 bucks. I'll be hitting this spot up frequently.

I ordered a cilantro lime chicken burrito on a wheat tortilla, brown rice, black beans, sautéed onions (nice flavor and twist to a burrito), jack cheese (they also have a cotija cheese option, winning), more cilantro, sour cream, pico and the hot sauce (while eating the burrito I requested a side of the hot sauce cuz it was off the hook). Bam, great flavor great price. I'll be getting burrito wasted at the Cantina Verde again.
author: Carlos S.

description: I went to this place for lunch with my coworkers! The prices are unbelievable. I ordered a salad with steak and chicken, onions, pico de gallo, chips, corn and other fixings! It tasted very good; the price you can't beat! It is cheaper than mixt greens! Definitely worth going back for again! Maybe I will try the tacos!
author: Jaiesha C.

description: Much better than chipotle and you get so much more selections. Taste awesome too! I am a big fan! :) this salad portion is enough for two people.
author: R A.

description:
LOVE IT - I will never cross the street for Plant food again.

This place is definitely worth a try.  In the last 16 days, I've been here 8 times - does that qualify as food addiction?   The service is fast and pleasant, the price is cheap, and the food is very fresh and YUM!  I'm big on eating healthy for fuel, and Verde fits the bill.  Friends would say that I have a thing for customizing food orders - this place caters to that need - as many add-ons as you want, most free.  I haven't found the food to be bland or "unsalty" at all (this from a girl who regularly salts everything from oatmeal to sliced fruit and enjoys extremely spicy food), so those comments seem weird, but maybe things were different in the beginning and they've adapted?  Here's how it stacks vs. my previous FiDi healthy go-tos:

Verde vs Mixt Greens: salads - MG is still salad heaven, but Verde is on the same level given the low wait time and half price.

Verde vs Foccaccia: Verde hands-down in price, taste, and speed.

Verde vs the Plant: see above: Verde has fewer menu options (they're a Mexican cantina, ya?), but way more food for your money (anyone else feel like Plant is running a racket?), better taste, better food quality (yes!), and MUCH more organized and speedy.  

Chi-pot-whaa?  That crazy loud franchise place with not-really-fresh food?  Seems overpriced and corporate, but I guess great if you support that kind of thing...
author: Charis S.

description:
It's good, cheaper than Chipotle (as everyone's said). 

Problem is the food isn't hot. I've been five times now, and it bothers me every time. I work a block away so it's not my walk back.

This would be a five star find if they'd just get their food to a higher temp!
author: Derek S.

description:
Just got into the bathroom and one of the employees was knocking on the door telling me to hurry up. Wtf? 

Food is alright. Overpriced, would rather get chipotle.
author: Diana C.

description:
I had their burrito bowl for lunch.
Their price is fair & moderate serving time. Taste is pretty much same as any other Mexican place. 
I really like their burrito quantity and more options in every category (eg: wheat tortilla & their variety of sides) Not sure if their food is organic, like chipotle, if so this will be my New Mexican food favorite.
author: Venkat K.

description: Closed on Sunday - even though their website says they're open from 7 - 7 Mon - Sun
author: Ken P.

description:
I came over here yesterday to grab some lunch to try them out now that they're officially open and have stopped giving away free food.

I like that they have more options than Chipotle, but otherwise I didn't really notice too much of a difference. I also liked the strawberry and watermelon agua frescas that they handed out to those of us in line waiting to place our orders.

I ordered a carne asada burrito bowl with white rice (they were out of all other types of rice), shredded jack cheese, red sauce, shredded lettuce and mushrooms. I did also notice that they offered some squash, red onions, and a wider variety of salsas that I barely looked at. They also had egg pieces, avocado, guacamole, chips and some other various toppings that I could've added. They advertised corn on the menu board, but I didn't see any, so I didn't get any to put on :(  Sad.

The red sauce/salsa isn't hot (thank goodness; didn't think to ask before ordering but there wasn't any sort of hotness indication next to it on the menu so I sort of assumed it was safe), and they give you an okay amount of everything -- for $6.50+tax, you don't really have too much room to complain. I found the bowl to be pretty filling (didn't finish all of it), but nothing about the flavors blew me away as being particular better than Chipotle or anything. I'd go back, if only because it's nearby and because it's cheaper than Chipotle as well (though only by a negligible amount).
author: Anna W.

description:
This place looked good from the outside. I see a lot of people coming in and out, so I figured I would give it a shot. I was not impressed. There was nothing bad about it. The food was fresh but I felt like it was lacking something.

Assembly line style build your own burrito/soft taco. No crispy taco was bumber.

The line did move fast that is plus if you are in a hurry. Also the price is good for what you get especially for the area.
author: Ben M.

description:
Newly opened Cantina Verde is finally here!

The entire first week of March was their soft / grand opening and they gave away free breakfast and free lunch the whole week! Dont know how they do it, but a lot of people tried it.

I'm happy to support a local business especially when their ingredients were very fresh and the bowls I've gotten have been really good. They give generous portions and they have a different variety of veggies. 

Even for chicken, they have two kinds! 

Their service has been great so far... but I must suggest that their workers should pick up the pace especially if they expect to get busy.
author: Kenny L.

description:
I went back for a regular burrito and was not very impressed.  The carnitas were completely devoid of flavor, and the girl behind the counter actually rolled her eyes at me when I couldn't decide in a split second what I wanted on the burrito.  Bitch, please!

By the time I got back to my desk, which is in an office building right across the street - it was stone cold.

No thanks.
author: .Hon H.

description: Best combination of food and cost of all the Mexican spots downtown.
author: Bertram W.

description: Such a rude person working!! Went for breakfast and their music was super loud where the guy couldn't hear me order so I spoke a little louder and he got angry and said he doesn't like it when people yell at him after just slapping the ingredients in the burrito. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone. If you don't want your customers shouting at you turn the music down so am we don't have to!!
author: Jose G.

description: I got a little upset when I read the reviews for this place. This is my go-to spot in FiDi, I'm here 3-4 times a week. Their $6.95 salads are enormous and can add a huge heaping pile of avocado for a buck. The steak and avocado salad feels like it weighs a pound and its $7.95 cmon people that's insane for FiDi prices. Flavors are good, prices unbeatable, portions huge. And healthier than chipotle. It's not Mexican food but it's quality fresh healthy food for cheap. Exactly what I like. The people who gave it 2 stars I'm guessing also put their dogs in sweaters and are going to vote Hillary 2016. Good, the line is long enough, go enjoy your vegan chai lattes somewhere else
author: Brandon L.

description:
Don't get me wrong. I think Chipotle is a good chain. And frankly, emulating them is not a bad idea. But let's be honest-that's exactly what this place is. They have slightly more ingredients to choose from, but the ambience(really? ambience in a cafeteria style chain?) is a lot more boring. The all grey interior recalls the experience of  taking your lunch break in your cubicle. 

If you brought me a burrito from both places, I'd be hard pressed to tell the difference. A bad thing? No, not at all. A great thing? No, not at all. It's just a thing. Sadly, there's not many other quality places in the immediate area to grab a stellar burrito, so I'm going to make them my default until further notice.
author: Steve A.

description:
I stumbled across this spot today and decided to check it out. Like everyone said, its very similar to Chipotle, but has a ton of more options. 

The price was great, the food tasted fresh, and I will go back. The only serious con for me is that its VERY hard to order. I am about 5'2" and could not hear/yell over the tall glass. The music was loud, the servers were quiet...it was just not a good experience for me. Consider turning the music down to make an easier ordering experience.
author: Anne K.

description: I love this place for its breakfast bowls.  Fresh food at a very reasonable price, and the staff are super friendly.
author: Paul G.

description:
Yay for good burritos! Boo for not having tofu available! When they said they didn't have any tofu at the time, it reminded me 15 years ago when veggie burgers first started being introduced at fast food chains... they were so rarely requested, it would take 10 minutes to prepare it since they had to thaw the patty out. I don't know if they were genuinely out or like the veggie patties of yore, unprepared to have it requested that it wasn't available, but I was disappointed to not be able to try it.

Fortunately, they did have a grilled veggie mix for those who don't partake of the animal, so I ordered that, along with beans, rice and cheese. Similar to the Chipotle burrito line, you order at one end, go along the line and pick your toppings and pay at the end. Pricing was similar to other burrito shops in the FiDi area.

Service was good, not too busy when we went for lunch during the the work week, seating seems a bit tight, but overall it was a good burrito. Next time though, I'm bringing my own bottle of chipotle flavoured tabasco.
author: Cassandra J.

description:
In reviewing Cantina Verde, I can't help but compare it to Chipotle. Their basic menu mirrors Chipotle's, but they definitely have more unique ingredients including mushrooms and sautéed onions. The downfall is that they only let you add 1 "special" vegetable to your bowl before charging for extras. They do have a good selection of fresh vegetables, but I thought their carnitas lacked flavor and overall I just wasn't as satisfied with my burrito bowl as I am when I go to Chipotle.

It does feel healthier and lighter than Chipotle, which is great for SF and the Financial District lunch crowd. I will be back, but it's not my favorite burrito bowl.
author: Annaliese D.

description:
This place just opened today and for their soft opening they were handing out free tacos and aguas frescas.
The concept is the same as Chipotle: stand in line, look at the simple menu, customize your taco, burrito or bowl, pay, and eat.
The food is good, and they get an extra star for the variations that Chipotle doesn't have: jalapeno pinto beans, cotija cheese (which is what should go on a Mexican street style taco), and two different kinds of chicken (spicy and cilantro lime). I tried a taco with each of the two kinds of chicken and the carne asada. All of the ingredients were fresh and delish. A welcome addition to this block.
author: Matt H.

description: Essentially borrowed from the Chipotle model. I had a whole wheat cilantro lime chicken burrito with the brown rice and black beans (undercooked) with added mushrooms and avocado slices. It was okay, borderline bland. It's no Mission burrito, that's for sure.
author: Maximillian M.

description:
I realize this is nothing more than a poor man's Chipotle (which is a poor man's taqueria), but how can a burrito bar offer so many different ingredients and still be so one-dimensional?

They should consider renaming themselves Cantina Sal.
author: Annie G.

description: Good burritos for a decent price. They have so many different add-ons to their burritos and salads my favorite are the grilled mushrooms.
author: Taylor G.

description:
Solid Chipotle knock-off but definitely lacking in the flavor department. 

If you care more about price than flavors though, you've come to the right place. You'll probably save about $4-5 for a slightly larger portion size AND have fresher/healthier ingredients to boot. 

I got a salad with chipotle chicken, corn, sautéed onions, tomatoes, cilantro, chips, avocado, and chipotle dressing all for $7.50! Definitely a good deal in the Financial District. Just don't expect it to blow your taste buds away.
author: Rachel L.

description: Another one of my typical lunch spots. Its very similar to chipotle but I actually like it better. Its similar in the sense that its make your own burrito or burrito bowl or salad type of place. I usually order to beef burrito bowl with brown rice, black beans, cheese, fresh tomatoes, corn and lettuce. The ingredients taste nice and fresh and I find there is more flavor than Chipotle. Also the beef was cooked perfectly, not overcooked like at other places. All in all a great grab and go place. There's also lots of seating in case you want to eat there.
author: Sami F.

description: A great Fi-Di Fresh-Mex lunch spot.Fresh, tasty, reasonably priced, fast, friendly & clean. A step up from Chipotle in taste & a slight step down in price.
author: Tad B.

description:
Pretty good. As others have said it is very similar to Chipotle, although I do agree the ingredients seem fresher than Chipotle. I got a burrito and a Coke (they have the bottled ones with the real sugar available and they will even open it for you) for around $9 I believe. The burrito itself was $6.50. A lot of customization options available for your burrito. The burrito was good, but not outstanding, which I believe was probably just my poor customization. But, for the price I would definitely come back and maybe ask them for a recommendation to really get a great burrito. The burrito was huge, the people were friendly, and the line moved quickly at about 1:30pm. 

I took my burrito and Coke down to the waterfront to enjoy which was great on a particularly warm San Francisco day. I ended up spilling half of the Coke after being flustered by a car horn, but hey, that's my life.
author: Brian A.

description: Definitely better and healthier than chipotle. Will try it again next time I come to SF
author: Ron C.

description:
This place is such a great Chipotle knockoff that I would choose it over Chipotle any day of the week. I usually opt for the create-your-own salad. For only $6.50, I can get a gigantic box of mixed greens with roasted vegetables and yummy chipotle chicken. It's pretty hard to beat that kind of value. Also, the tomatoes taste really fresh! The line gets super long during lunch time, but thankfully it moves quickly. 

I'm not sure how the burritos are, but when 75% of the customers are ordering salads/bowls, you know which is the better option.

It's hard to grab healthy and tasty food when you're squeezing lunch into a busy day. Cantina Verde does a good job of balancing the two at a low price.
author: Anna N.

description:
This place is very similar to Chipotle.  You have the option to have a burrito, burrito bowl, or taco.  The good thing about this place is that all the meats are the same price unlike Chipotle, where each meat has a different price.  However, even if you get vegetarian and you want guacamole, they will charge you for the guac.  

The first time I tried this place out, they gave me the wrong meat.  I wanted steak, they gave me braised pork.  The pork was good and all, but I wanted steak still. I also asked for tortilla on the side and I never received it.  So when you go during the busy hours, speak a little louder because apparently they can't hear you over that window that separates us from them.  The bowl was very good though, it is definitely a bigger portion than Chipotle.  I added brown rice, black beans, pinto beans, mushrooms, zucchinis, salsa, cheese, lettuce, and bell pepper.  Flavors are definitely different from Chipotle, but it tasted pretty good if you want to avoid the typical long line at Chipotle.  

In conclusion, food is good, service could be better.
author: Ellen Z.

description:
I like this place!  I like to get the salads and tacos here.  The carne asada and both chickens are really good.  $6.50 for either burrito, taco, or salad. Avocado or guacamole is extra.  The verde salad is easy but I usually like to amend, so I pick my own toppings.  Fresh and delicious and FAST.  The sounds travels quite a bit, so hard to understand the staff and I don't think they can hear me either.  They keep the door open generally, which I don't like but not too bad on a warm day. Mostly good for takeaway. 

I do have to say that the amount of greens I get in the box in varied and today it didn't fill up the box, where is the week before it did.
author: Betty L.

description:
Great service, friendly management and staff, great food. Simple menu that absolutely hits the spot. 
Decor is clean, warm, and modern. 
I had the breakfast burrito and it was exactly what I was looking for.
author: L M.

description: Food is fairly decent. Similar concept as chipotle only they have different flavored protein. For the portion that I receive from the old guy behind the counter, not worth the price.  I would recommend chipotle over this place.
author: Andy N.

description: I got charged $8.16 for a cheese quesadilla. The cashier said they have to charge me like a full burrito. They could've told me that at the beginning rather than after the food is already made. Talk about a rip off.
author: Saumya B.

description: I was quite impressed with the breakfast burrito I had here. The best I have found in the FiDi!  Very reasonably priced.
author: Adrienne G.

description:
It's the same concept as chipotle but with a variety. You can pick what greens you want if you want a salad and they have different sauteed veggie options like mushrooms and squash. Also you have the option of getting sliced pieces of avocados or their guac. 

I ordered a chicken chipotle salad over spring mixed greens, added guac and also ordered a watermelon aguas fresca. Altogether it was about $10 and very filling for me. I liked the spicy jicama and sauteed mushrooms in my salad, it was refreshing.

Also, first time I wanted to try this place I was a little lost. Its a little off market, where the old sellers market used to be, around the corner from the starbucks so just a heads up.

Also, looks like it does get pretty busy here for lunch so be sure to come here a little before noon or after 1pm
author: Christine W.

description: I've eaten at this place twice now. Both times had a House Salad. Good salad, however the sign outside both soora advertise the salad price as .$6.50 but the real price is $8.50. The employees just say it is an old sign and the owner knows. Hmmm false advertisement.
author: S V.

description:
When they first opened they were super nice, smiles, what can I get you's, etc. Now that they've been around for a while they couldn't be bothered. Their food is ok, and this place is convenient.  What drove me to Yelp them is that the older lady with glasses is exceptionally rude. They offered all veggies free when they first opened. Then, it was your pick of two of the four offered veggies.Today, it was only 1 item free and she dismissed me like I'm not even a customer. Their sign says you can have "up to 3 of the following: bell peppers, red onions, mushrooms, zucchinni & squash. Obviously they don't care about updating their false advertising.

She was all smiles for the guy behind me, maybe because I'm female she can't turn on her feminine wiles on me and so it's not worth the extra effort? When I snagged her attention about the veggies, she tells me it's 1 item only and again dismissed me.  Ok, so you charge now - what if I wanted the extra veggies at the extra charge?  Doesn't matter, because I never got the chance to tell her I wanted the extra veggie since she again dismissed me and turned on that 1000 watt smile to again cater to the guy behind me.  Terrible service from her, ok service from the others, and ok food.  Just make sure you're a guy, and maybe you'll be ok.
author: kit p.

description:
I agree with Matt, first it is awesome they are doing a soft open with FREE food. 

I got a breakfast burrito (eggs, beans, salsa, crema) and it was scrumptious. I came right at 930a when they were closing so they were 86 on a couple of proteins but hey - free soft open, no complaints. 

Service seemed a little burnt out but food came out quick and clean. 

The owner / manager was working the food line and appeared not to understand spoken Spanish, I don't know what that means. Worrisome to me. I asked for jalapenos and they had none but they had green salsa that contained jalapenos. I don't know if they ran out or just don't plan to offer them. 

Besides those minor observations, the place looks like it'll do well.
author: jim b.

description: Well, i am still trying to find a good burrito downtown.  I grabbed a carinitas burrito with peppers, cheese, pinto beans, white rice and salsa verde.   The good - i was surprised at the size of the protein portion.  The bad:  That was the most bland burrito I have had in a while.  Also, why are they so chintzy with salsa and cheese?  I asked twice for more than three shred's of cheese only to have in increased to nine.  I told the lady i was happy to pay more which did not help.  Even more baffling than the cheese was the salsa.  The lady filled the ladle up, then proceeded to pour 90% of it back into the container ending up with 10 small drips on the burrito.  I asked for more and once again filled it up and poured it back out.  It was almost comical.  I just quit trying at that point.  I am giving them two stars because i might have just hit them on a bad day but overall it was a very bad burrito.
author: Stuart B.

description: So disappointed with service here. I had a habit of swinging by for guac and chips and today I decided to get a salad bowl. The menu and layout here is parallel to Chipotle. Choose a bowl, burrito, salad, etc. then your meat then your toppings. There are more vegetable options here which is why I was excited to try the food. The best part about these bowls is you can load them up. Chipotle is generous with their veggies and salsas so you're never left craving more. I was so excited for Verde's options. I asked for chicken, peppers, onions, zucchini, mushrooms, mild salsa, shredded cheese, sour cream, cucumbers and vinaigrette. This woman PISSED me off. She didn't even use the full scoop when serving. I asked for more onions, and zuchini and cheese and she just stared at me. I asked twice more, then finally she put only TWO extra pieces of zucchini and a string of onion. Same with the salsas. I asked for cucumbers and vinaigrette. I got charged $1 extra for veggies (where's my FULL second scoop?!) and 50 cents for chips which by the way are the same charge as CUCUMBERS. really?! you're charging me extra for cucumbers and for veggies you barely put on there? and you have the audacity to roll your eyes? Very disappointing. Such a bad attitude, i'm surprised you didn't spit in my food. with all the charges, I paid just under $10 for everything, which i know isn't horrible for FiDi, but If i knew service would be so horrible, I would much rather have gone to Mixt Greens, The Plant or Chipotle itself. disappointing, and not very tasty in the end. Not coming back.
author: Zara S.

description: It was aight.  Just your standard burrito eatery.  About as good as Chipotle.
author: Raj G.

description: I went to Cantina Verde for the first time today with a Co-worker. I ordered the chips,guacamole and one chicken taco. They now have a new customer. The customer service was very good!!!!!!!
author: Zina J.

description: Ugh, I wanted to like this place. I call it the "poor man's Chipotle." I've tried the tacos, the burritos and the salad and the only thing that's good is the house salad. I would give this place 4 stars just on the salad, but lately I've noticed that they are increasingly stingy on any toppings. Smallest scoops possible of cheese and corn. Two slivers of avocado. Two HALVES of a cherry tomato.  An almost $9 salad should have double what they give on the toppings.  And then they look at you like you're crazy when you protest the TWO HALVES of a small CHERRY tomato.  I'm done. I'll pay three extra dollars and get a full salad at Foccacia.
author: Stephanie E.

description: This place is similar to Chipotle, but it's got way more choices and tastier ingredients.  Adding guacamole only costs $1, not $2 as in Chipotle. I only wish they have restaurants in more locations.
author: Sienna W.

description: It was ok, but I am not a fan of cold burritos. It reminds me of chipotle. I was in a hurry, and wanted something quick before I went to work. I ordered a burrito with carnitas, and it was alright. Not amazing, and also too salty. I may not go there again. I'll have to suck it up and go to the mission.
author: Tiffany M.

description:
Essentially a Chipotle replica, however I enjoyed their burrito more than a Chipotle burrito.

They also have a pretty good breakfast burrito.
author: Emre G.

description: The employees need big time training on customer service (specifically talking abt 2 young girls that are working today) smile when you see a customer please! From the service they provide me I felt like they were doing me a favor for making my burrito and charging me on that cashier machine. The food is alright.
author: Jazzy H.

description: burritos were kind of sad, but cheap. Not the worst, definitely not the best. Carnitas tasted weird, like they included cinnamon. kind of an orangish color. veggies were fresh. Kind of a good choice for a late late lunch.
author: Dean N.

description: Cantina Verde is just like Chipotle and Qdoba - it's quick, convenient and pretty inexpensive. I love that they have wheat tortillas.
author: Melissa W.

description: This place is very close to being a great spot, but management overhaul is needed!  Every time I leave I feel ripped off. The staff is not friendly, very pushy. It's like I'm not even allowed to think about what I want to put in my bowl.  When I do select an item I get a half ass scoop and they are very reluctant to add more.  By the time I was done my bowl was half empty and I had 6 different items thrown into it.  For now I'm sticking with chipotle...I feel better about my purchase when I'm done.  This place could be a home run...but I leave with a sour taste too many times.
author: Andrew J.

description: Line is always long but moves fast. Fresh ingredients. Prefer this spot over Chipotle. Always clean. Price is super reasonable considering we're downtown.
author: Chayla G.

description:
Any place in the financial district where you can find a healthy lunch for under seven bucks is a score to me. Here, $6.50 gets you a nice sized custom built burrito.

You get a choice between white and wheat tortillas.
Their guacamole is divine, veggies seem fresh, there's a choice of beans...I might stay clear of the chipotle chicken next time. Not bad, but not completely stelar.

Pretty cool place. I'd go back.
author: Eva D.

description: They don't offer Spanish rice which is ridiculous. Our choices are plain white rice and brown rice. Their tortillas are just steamed and not grilled and the food is barely luke warm. By the time I get to my office (which isn't far) everything is cold. On the plus side, everything is fresh.
author: Michelle V.

description:
Great breakfast burritos.  A lot more flavor than your standard breakfast burrito with fresh veggies and salsa.  Bacon is crispy and has a nice flavor as well.

Lunch has more variety than chipotle and ingredients seem fresher.  Great flavor on the chicken.

Clean environment and friendly service.
author: Andrew W.

description: Best Breakfast Burrito spot in Financial District, hands down (and I've tried them all).   Huge portions, only slightly over $5, all fresh ingredients, and very friendly staff.
author: Sondra O.

description: Cantina Verde!!!! Are you trying to kill someone? I built an insane appetite after waiting in your excessively long line. Then I had to tolerate being nickel and dimmed on the price to add veggies, not cool. I finally got to work hungry as a bear and ready to dig into my Carnitas bowl. About halfway through my meal I took a bite and dang near broke a molar and choked to death on this massive bone!!! I get it, I'm eating an animal and animals have bones, however, your Carnitas engineers need to do a better job of making sure your food is safe for people to consume. My colleagues are in disbelief that this is even a bone, they think its rock. They threw it against the wall and we even took a hammer to it and it still held its form! SOLID! After the embarrassing moment of almost choking to death passed and I cleaned the foam from the sides of my mouth, I called your phone number which doesn't work! I got a message about your subscribers mailbox being full and unable to except any more messages. I guess you're as thorough at cleaning up your mailbox as you are at inspecting your food before you serve it, BOOM! I'm taking my business to Chipotle where the line is even longer, but I don't have to fear for my life.
author: Izac C.

description: Solid Healthy mexican food! I had the three tacos (single corn tortilla - aka street tacos) and choose three different meats since this was my first time here. The meats were the Chipotle Chicken, Lime Chicken and the Carnitas (Pork). The carnitas were hands down the best but enjoyed the other two as well. There are a lot of items to choose from when dressing your taco but I kept it authentic and simple with some onions, a sprinkle of cheese, and the salsa verde - the carnitas I left plain with just cheese and squirt of lime. I'm from Southern California so I have definitely been missing Mexican food and this satisfied the craving. The only downside is I felt a little rushed and one of the Taco masters seemed a little annoyed that I wanted to garnish each of my tacos a little differently. Why not!?
author: Noel A.

description: I haven't written a review here yet? I love this place and I'm a regular. I love to build a salad here from their fresh ingredients but when I'm in a hurry, I'll order the House salad. It's not put up in advance so it's equally fresh but the server can put the ingredients together quickly by rote which saves me time. I really like their Chipotle sauce and usually request a double serving.
author: Paula H.

description: This place recently opened up across the street from my office. I just heard about it today and decided I'd try it at lunch. Got there about 1:30 and the line was pretty short. Maybe 5 people ahead of me in line. The concept is like Chipotle. I agree with a lot of the other reviews. The employees in the assembly line are behind a glass partition so you're struggling to hear what they're asking and you're screaming to tell them what you want. I am a 5'1 Shorty. So, it's a bit of a challenge for me. This place is great for the vegans as the veggie options are more extensive. I ordered a carnitas burrito with a bunch of stuff on it including guacamole and sour cream. A little stingy with both. Again, I agree with some of the other reviews that Chipotle, hands down has the best seasoned meat. CV is not bad, but Chipotle is better. The pros for me is that it's right outside my building and the line is 10 times shorter than Chipotle. I can deal with it. The cost of my burrito came to almost $9. I guess the extra cost for the guacamole. But definitely try it for yourself. I will continue to come back.
author: LyonQueen P.

description:
If I was basing this strictly on the food it would be 5 stars.  So much better than Chipotle since it gives you so many more veggie options and I like their dressing better than Chipotle too.  Their chicken is so much better too.  Chipotle's always is so fatty tasting.

But their service is what brings it down to a 2 star rating.  In fact if I were to be rating this strictly on service it would be a 0.  It is so hard to hear all of them behind the counter.  The music is way too loud, most of the people who work there don't speak English very well and they are all so soft spoken that it gets very frustrating trying to communicate with them.  The guy in front of me just now threw a hissyfit because it was so hard to communicate.

Which moves onto the next issue... When you first look at the menu you have a choice of burrito, bowl, salad or tacos and they are all listed as $6.50.  So I have always ordered the salad.  I always order the same toppings on the salad too.  Today when I got to the cash register they said it was $7.50 plus tax instead of $6.50.  I asked why and they said because it is a salad. I pointed out the sign at the far end and they said no a salad is $7.50.  I had this same thing happen to me one other time and it was explained that if I got the avocado/guac on the salad then it would be $7.50 but since I don't it should be $6.50.  I tried to explain this to the person at the register and she continued to argue with me that because I got veggies on top of the salad it was $7.50.  This just doesn't make sense and they should figure out how to make things more clear.
author: Raigan E.

description:
I don't understand the other glowing reviews, what am I missing?  I went in at 1pm to avoid the lunch crowd.  Still a decent line since the assembly line was pretty ineffective.  Same thing as Chipotle, but little cheaper.  Most of the ingredients are pretty tasteless, salsa is super watery, they might as well just pour tomato juice all over my burrito.

Yet another disappointing MX place at FiDi.
author: CalBear H.

description: Tofu rice bowl is really good option for vegetarians, similar to chipotle with more options
author: Divy S.

description:
$6.50 for a burrito in the FiDi was to good to be true  - and it lived up to it too .. 
chipotle (3 blocks away) should have felt the heat already !
author: Fela K.

description: Great place to eat salads for lunch. I recommend getting a verde house salad and it gets you really full.
author: Kaydee B.

description: I LOVE this place.  I used to go to Chipotle at least once a week, now I go here.  They have a wider variety of veggies, and some of the stuff they serve actually has some spice to it.  The staff is really friendly (if you go a couple times, they will remember you and say it's nice to see you again!) and the price is very reasonable.  Plus the line is way shorter than Chipotle, most of the time, and it moves faster. :)  And they're open in the evenings if you need to grab dinner and work late - not too many options around here for that, so this is a welcome addition.
author: KT R.

description: Another pretty great lunch spot found for me and my co-workers!  Good price for a healthier and more authentic version of Chipotle.  Little tables are outside so you can catch some sun while eating your food.  Would be 5-star but the food doesn't look extremely fresh and kind of reminds me of Q'doba.  Anyways, would be back again simply because it tasted healthy and was a great price for what you get.
author: Louise Z.

description: This was a surprise and I was more than pleased. I was wanting a breakfast burrito and I found this place that has a setup like Chipotle where you can build your own burrito. It was huge and very reasonable considering it's in the Financial District.  Very impressed.  I ended up splitting it with a friend because it was more than enough for two. She thought it was pretty amazing as well. Thank you!
author: Venka A.

description: Went here with a couple coworkers.  Not only was the service subpar, but one of my coworkers found a caterpillar in her chicken salad.  Will not be returning.
author: Jayson S.

description: Tastes very similar to chipotle but I felt verde salsa is better. They even have more variety of veggies to choose from. Chicken pieces are soft and juicy. I got a bowl which costed me $7.
author: Riya G.

description:
I rounded up from 4.5 stars (the half star minus was because they don't have rice for the breakfast burritos).

This breakfast burrito is pretty f'n awesome! I usually only get one on Fridays, because it's pretty big and I'm not trying to work out my table muscle THAT hard.

I think this is the best breakfast burrito I've had in FiDi. I get half chorizo, half bacon, regular eggs, roasted potatoes, medium salsa, and a healthy dose of jack cheese. Glorious.

Also, these guys are SUPER nice people. You go in there and you just want them to succeed. 

Great quality, fresh ingredients a few bucks cheaper than Chipotle? Oh si si si!
author: S D.

description: Let me start of by saying I agree with everyone. ..it is a knock-off of Chipotle. You select if you want a bowl, tacos, burrito or a salad then walk through the assembly line and pick your toppings.  The favors are different than Chipotle with a few extra options available.
author: Jessi D.

description: Great salads. Just went for the second time and really like this place. I've tried both types of chicken and have not been disappointed. A variety of options and a large portion for a decent price. I'll be back soon to try other meat options.
author: Rise G.

description: I know I've already written a review for their regular burritos, but I just had a breakfast burrito this morning, and I have found the new love of my life! This is HUGE!!!!! also comes with the option of egg whites, which finding at no extra charge is unheard of. You get fresh veggies, your choice of numerous kinds of meets, and salsas. I was so happy to find that their breakfast burritos are not only the same price as small terrible ones EVERYWHERE else in the FiDi, but also just so much better tasting (fresher!). I now work catercorner from Verde, this isn't going to end well for my hips!
author: Dawn O.

description:
I would choose this over Plant, Chipotle, or Mixt Greens if I was feeling like a fresh mex/salad kind of day.   Chipotle is soooo bland.  This place is one step up on the bland chart. Everything tasted fresh, just not really spicy enough for me, but I keep hot sauce back at my office.   They give you generous portions of toppings, so much so that my salad greens were overwhelmed. Not enough lettuce provided. And next time I will get my dressing on the side as I had a large pool of it left after I finished my salad.  

Chicken was more tender/flavorful than all the aforementioned food venues.
author: Mya P.

description: Not worth it.  Yes they have a little more selection, but the portion sizes and all the "extras" are not worth it.  I'm a vegetarian and I ordered a burrito bowl with a tortilla on the side.  I'd never been to this restaurant before but I felt everything I wanted was considered "extra" and my salad was half the size of the bowl.  I'm sorry, but it wasn't worth it.  One of the workers was wonderful and interacted with customers...an older fellow.  The rest....no help. no direction. nothing.  I couldn't figure out how to order and the only one who helped was the older gentlemen.
author: Francesca C.

description: This is just like a Chipotle except they are doing more of an organic play. I did like their lime cilantro brown rice but that was about it. The chips needed some salt, quacamole was only so so, and the salsa isn't very flavorful. They include the option of fresh veggies but for "Mexican Food" it lacked flavor to call it Mexican Food. I don't think I'll be coming back.
author: Linda L.

description: I'm a regular lunchee here, so I guess it's about time I wrote them a review. Cantina Verde is very Chipotle-esque with their walk-up service. I've been to Chipotle once in my life btw, so I don't know how I'm comparing CV to Chipotle. Lunch time anywhere in the FiDi is a crazy, happenin' place! Cantina Verde is one of those places. Every day during the lunch rush, the line is literally out the door. The employees handle their business professionally and very systematically! They're "assembly line" is accurate and they keep the line moving so quick that standing outside the door isn't a long wait at all. I remember standing at the foot of the door one day, and the line moved even before I was able to Check In to Yelp! The food is fresh, everything is prepared in front of you, and you get to pick any and everything you want to put in your bowl, burrito, taco, salad...whatever it is your stomach desires for the day. While the interior is modern and even somewhat has an industrial feel, the seating is very tight. I'm only 5'1" but it's like sitting on a child's seat and your ass is hanging off! In addition, you're literally shoulder to shoulder to the person sitting next to you. Or in my case, shoulder to elbow :-/
author: Marie T.

description: I used to be a big fan of chipotle until I found cantina verde. The options here are fresh and abundant compared to chipotle. I ordered wheat tortilla burrito with cilantro lime chicken and added everything including hickama and avacado. Best part is they don't charge extra for guac and it's the same, if not cheaper than chipotle. My buritto was 5 lbs with all the toppings I added all for $7 including tax. Where else can you get a cheap and quality food in FiDi? Good bye chipotle.
author: Jack S.

description: I don't know how people can compare this place to Chiplotle other than in the style in which the food is served. For one, the quality of the food is better. Secondly, the people are way less ghetto. You get more food for your money and you get whatever you want on it. Finally, I got violently ill the last time I went to Chiplotle. I have been here multiple times and all of the food is always cooked well and fresh. It's my new go-to.
author: Zoeboe D.

description: Debated between two and three stars, because, really, it is the same concept of Chipotle, but not as good, and the Chipotle is only two blocks away.  I went for the verde chicken burrito and got the verde sauce - thinking I might as well given them their best shot.  It was perfectly fine, but nothing special.  The husband got the salad and it was only half full in the container - come on, give him some more lettuce - its cheap.  Overall, will not return and instead wait in line at Chipotle.  On a side note, the staff were friendly and helpful, but the trashcans were overflowing even though it was not that busy?!
author: Alison T.

description: I've had both a breakfast burrito (bacon) and chicken salad that I chose the ingredients.  Both were very good and worth the cost.  They have healthy options like egg whites and tofu. Etc.
author: Dkac C.

description: Love their tacos! Price is really reasonable esp since they are located in the financial district. Definitely will return again!
author: Juls W.

description: Cantina Verde is literally Chipotle but with a few more options. It certainly is priced better, but I don't see it as anything different or outstanding. The amount of add-ins you can get for your burrito / bowl / whatever is better than Chipotle, but the quality is your standard quick Mexican takeout. Great if you want to have a few more options to add to your meal (avocado slices, mushrooms, lime wedges, etc.) but nothing special.
author: John S.

description: i love cantina verde! the line moves faster than chipotle and the employees are more friendly. they're all super friendly. they have great deals and their guac is $1 (vs $2 at chipotle).
author: Sonya Z.

description: Great spot in FiDi for burritos/tacos. Owners are great and very friendly. The food is well priced for the area and I waited in line for the soft opening and was well worth it! Must get chipotle sauce on your burrito! Yumm!
author: Austin S.

description: I"M OBSESSED!! The House Verde Salad is bomb! The chicken has so much flavor! Lots of healthy options to choose from. The line goes fast and the price is right. Healthy meal for a good price in financial district is unheard of. I take this over Chipotle  for sure!
author: Sofia J.

description: Great portions, friendly staff, great agua fresca selections. Boom town!! My only complaint is I wish there was one in Las Vegas. Will visit again when I'm back in town.
author: Juan Carlos R.

description: I have tried their salads a while back which were good (3 1/2 stars). Today I ordered a carnitas burrito. Tortilla is chewy and hard...like can't bite through the ends at all. The carnitas have zero flavor. This is the most disappointing burrito I have ever eaten. The service is lack luster... cashiers here always seem annoyed. Don't think I'll be returning here for a burrito ever, maybe a salad.
author: lenka l.

description: Breakfast burritos are I'm not a big fan of the lunch menu. Very chipotle like feel to this place.
author: Richard C.

description: Chipotle wanna-be, mexican restaurant in fidi. I had heard some good things about this place so decided to give it a shot. At first glance, the prices look very reasonable but what you get in the end is not worth it. The burrito bowl has much less quantity than that at chipotle and the ingredients at chipotle still taste more fresh to me. You can choose from a variety of proteins or just grilled veggies. I really liked the idea that all their veggies were split up and you could decide for yourself which ones you wanted. On the other hand, you had to pick one dairy option - meaning you had to pick between sour cream or cheese. If you wanted both, like me, you would have to pay 50 cents extra. Is it that bad to want both sour cream and cheese in your burrito? It is very unclear on their menu what is included and what they would charge extra for. The verde salsa was nice and tangy but besides that, nothing was spectacular. I will probably not be back again.
author: Malika R.

description:
I have been to Catina Verde at least once per week since its grand opening.  There is a reason I keep going back - the food is awesome! 

I usually order a burrito.  My favorite is the carnitas, but I have tried the cilantro lime chicken and the steak, and I've even had them make me an all veggie burrito.  The proteins have great flavor.  Unlike a lot of burritos, the flavor of the meat doesn't get lost in all the other good stuff (rice, beans, etc.).  The ability to add all sorts of different vegetables into the burrito is a definite plus.  I haven't seen so many options at a taqueria-type spot before.  I really like all of the options - from the veggies, to salsas, to cheese - you can make a totally different burrito (or taco or salad) every time you go.  

To top it off, the staff are really friendly - a lot more than can be said for most of the FiDi lunch spots.  And, the price point is great, too.  I don't know too many places downtown where you can walk out with lunch for well under $10.  Overall a great experience.  Definitely recommend trying it!
author: F R.

description:
The short version of this review is: there's way better choices for a burrito even in the FiDi (i.e. Rico Mex or Tlalak), and if you really are feeling for a Chipotle style burrito, go to Chipotle, not this poor imitation.

Full version: I decided to give this place a go today and was there at about 1:30.  There was no line at that time which was nice, but after trying the food, I think I know why.  

I went with a carnitas burrito on a wheat tortilla with brown rice, black beans, onions, bell peppers, sour cream, cheese, chipotle sauce, "spicy" red sauce, and fresh jalepenos.  I also got a side of chips and more of their red sauce.  

I started with their chips and they were really bad, tasting like stale Mission brand tortilla chips.  Their red sauce which they claim to be spicy was incredibly bland, similar to mild Tostitos salsa.  The burrito itself was a little better, although it's not something to write home about.  The highlight was the fresh jalepenos however even those were fairly bland.  

As the place is clearly a Chipotle clone with a fresh/healthier focus, I'm going to compare them to Chipotle.  The burrito from CV seemed a little smaller, and it was way less flavorful.  The amount of meat they give you is about the same, but everything else is a bit less.  The chips & salsa from Chipotle are in a different league compared to CV, we're talking orders of magnitude better.  Even compared to other Chipotle clones like Freebird, CV doesn't compare well.

In terms of service, the folks working there were friendly and well meaning, and the turnaround time was fairly quick.  However given the lack of flavor, I don't plan to eat there again (at least not for lunch).
author: Nick A.

description:
I really like this place.

The food is fresh and the choices are great. I have been there three times so far, and have happily created something new each time.

The multiple veggie options are what really stand out for me. They are cooked perfectly and I can taste each one in the mix. I have had a breakfast burrito, tacos, and a burrito and have not been disappointed at all.

My kids also love it here!

The staff are very friendly and eager to make us customers happy. That is not as common as one would think these days, and it goes a long way.
author: CC K.

description: My second time at Cantina Verde today.  Ordered a breakfast burrito - half egg/whites, tofu, potatoes, salsa and it was HUGE!  For $5, I can eat this burrito for two meals.  I'll definitely be coming back!
author: Katniss B.

description: This review is for the breakfast burritos with chorizo. We ordered ahead for a group and were pleasantly surprised that the burritos would be ready in 10 to 15 minutes.  The burritos were made very well and it was evident that fresh ingredients were used.
author: pablo p.

description: way overpriced for filler veggies. i got a quinoa bowl. it was loaded with cheap filler veggies over quinoa. not worth it.
author: Shontai C.

description: I ordered a burrito.  The flavor was good, but the whole pinto beans were crunchy!  This is a critical, unforgivable mistake.  It spoiled an otherwise flavorful and affordable meal.  I've been eating Mexican food in SF for over 25 years and have never encountered improperly cooked beans before.  It just opened, so perhaps this is just a rookie mistake, but I'm unlikely to go again, even though it's right across the street.
author: Philip L.

description: This place is SO good! Everything was amazing. Fresh, delicious & super tasty!  So many options!!  The flavors are incredible!!!!  A definite recommend! Will be back!!!!
author: Nika C.

description: It's the same concept as Chipotle as others mentioned, but this place is even more California-fied.  There's more veggie options to add like sauteed mushrooms.  Mushrooms are not in traditional mexican burritos but I love mushrooms.  Overall good value.
author: Nexia L.

description: Unfortunately wasn't able to get there for the free food, but it was still more than worth the price I paid today.  Carnitas burrito was way more flavorful than Chipotle and there are many more options available to "build your own".  They've done a nice job with the decor as well.  I took to go, but will try to eat there next time as the spacing of tables and atmosphere were really nice. The line was a bit long at noon, but I guess that is kind of a good sign too.
author: Peter M.

description: I had one of their burritos for lunch yesterday, and it was amazing!  The whole wheat tortilla was the softest wheat tortilla I've had, and the chipotle chicken was tender and flavorful!  The guacamole and salsa was great, and brought together all of the flavors of the burrito!  I do regret not trying the Agua Fresca, I overheard a few people walking out with them, and they sounded pretty thrilled about them!
author: Aleks F.

description: This place just opened. The ingredients are extremely fresh and the food is delicious. The tacos and burritos take Chipotle out of the running. Chipotle is now like McDonalds to me after eating at this place. The staff is great and I highly recommend Cantina Verde.
author: Milo P.
